178/*
179 * general info:
180 *
181 * - for an explanation of how the x86 MMU hardware works see
182 * the comments in <machine/pte.h>.
183 *
184 * - for an explanation of the general memory structure used by
185 * this pmap (including the recursive mapping), see the comments
186 * in <machine/pmap.h>.
187 *
188 * this file contains the code for the "pmap module." the module's
189 * job is to manage the hardware's virtual to physical address mappings.
190 * note that there are two levels of mapping in the VM system:
191 *
192 * [1] the upper layer of the VM system uses vm_map's and vm_map_entry's
193 * to map ranges of virtual address space to objects/files. for
194 * example, the vm_map may say: "map VA 0x1000 to 0x22000 read-only
195 * to the file /bin/ls starting at offset zero." note that
196 * the upper layer mapping is not concerned with how individual
197 * vm_pages are mapped.
198 *
199 * [2] the lower layer of the VM system (the pmap) maintains the mappings
200 * from virtual addresses. it is concerned with which vm_page is
201 * mapped where. for example, when you run /bin/ls and start
202 * at page 0x1000 the fault routine may lookup the correct page
203 * of the /bin/ls file and then ask the pmap layer to establish
204 * a mapping for it.
205 *
206 * note that information in the lower layer of the VM system can be
207 * thrown away since it can easily be reconstructed from the info
208 * in the upper layer.
209 *
210 * data structures we use include:
211 *
212 * - struct pmap: describes the address space of one thread
213 * - struct pmap_page: describes one pv-tracked page, without
214 * necessarily a corresponding vm_page
215 * - struct pv_entry: describes one <PMAP,VA> mapping of a PA
216 * - struct pv_head: there is one pv_head per pv-tracked page of
217 * physical memory. the pv_head points to a list of pv_entry
218 * structures which describe all the <PMAP,VA> pairs that this
219 * page is mapped in. this is critical for page based operations
220 * such as pmap_page_protect() [change protection on _all_ mappings
221 * of a page]
222 */
223
224/*
225 * Locking
226 *
227 * We have the following locks that we must contend with:
228 *
229 * - pmap lock (per pmap, part of uvm_object)
230 * This lock protects the fields in the pmap structure including the
231 * non-kernel PDEs in the PDP, and the PTEs.
232 *
233 * - pvh_lock (per pv_head)
234 * This lock protects the pv_entry list which is chained off the pv_head
235 * structure for a specific pv-tracked PA. It is locked when traversing
236 * the list (e.g. adding/removing mappings, syncing R/M bits, etc).
237 *
238 * - pmaps_lock
239 * This lock protects the list of active pmaps (headed by "pmaps"). We
240 * lock it when adding or removing pmaps from this list.
241 */
242

263/*
264 * XXX kludge: dummy locking to make KASSERTs in uvm_page.c comfortable.
265 * actual locking is done by pm_lock.
266 */
267#if defined(DIAGNOSTIC)
268#define PMAP_SUBOBJ_LOCK(pm, idx) \
269 KASSERT(mutex_owned((pm)->pm_lock)); \
270 if ((idx) != 0) \
271 mutex_enter((pm)->pm_obj[(idx)].vmobjlock)
272#define PMAP_SUBOBJ_UNLOCK(pm, idx) \
273 KASSERT(mutex_owned((pm)->pm_lock)); \
274 if ((idx) != 0) \
275 mutex_exit((pm)->pm_obj[(idx)].vmobjlock)
276#else /* defined(DIAGNOSTIC) */
277#define PMAP_SUBOBJ_LOCK(pm, idx) /* nothing */
278#define PMAP_SUBOBJ_UNLOCK(pm, idx) /* nothing */
279#endif /* defined(DIAGNOSTIC) */

322#define PV_HASH_SIZE 32768
323#define PV_HASH_LOCK_CNT 32
324
325struct pv_hash_lock {
326 kmutex_t lock;
327} __aligned(CACHE_LINE_SIZE) pv_hash_locks[PV_HASH_LOCK_CNT]
328 __aligned(CACHE_LINE_SIZE);
329
330struct pv_hash_head {
331 SLIST_HEAD(, pv_entry) hh_list;
332} pv_hash_heads[PV_HASH_SIZE];
333
334static u_int
335pvhash_hash(struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t va)
336{
337
338 return (uintptr_t)ptp / sizeof(*ptp) + (va >> PAGE_SHIFT);
339}
340
341static struct pv_hash_head *
342pvhash_head(u_int hash)
343{
344
345 return &pv_hash_heads[hash % PV_HASH_SIZE];
346}
347
348static kmutex_t *
349pvhash_lock(u_int hash)
350{
351
352 return &pv_hash_locks[hash % PV_HASH_LOCK_CNT].lock;
353}
354
355static struct pv_entry *
356pvhash_remove(struct pv_hash_head *hh, struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t va)
357{
358 struct pv_entry *pve;
359 struct pv_entry *prev;
360
361 prev = NULL;
362 SLIST_FOREACH(pve, &hh->hh_list, pve_hash) {
363 if (pve->pve_pte.pte_ptp == ptp &&
364 pve->pve_pte.pte_va == va) {
365 if (prev != NULL) {
366 SLIST_REMOVE_AFTER(prev, pve_hash);
367 } else {
368 SLIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&hh->hh_list, pve_hash);
369 }
370 break;
371 }
372 prev = pve;
373 }
374 return pve;
375}

493/*
494 * p m a p h e l p e r f u n c t i o n s
495 */
496
497static inline void
498pmap_stats_update(struct pmap *pmap, int resid_diff, int wired_diff)
499{
500
501 if (pmap == pmap_kernel()) {
502 atomic_add_long(&pmap->pm_stats.resident_count, resid_diff);
503 atomic_add_long(&pmap->pm_stats.wired_count, wired_diff);
504 } else {
505 KASSERT(mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
506 pmap->pm_stats.resident_count += resid_diff;
507 pmap->pm_stats.wired_count += wired_diff;
508 }
509}
510
511static inline void
512pmap_stats_update_bypte(struct pmap *pmap, pt_entry_t npte, pt_entry_t opte)
513{
514 int resid_diff = ((npte & PTE_P) ? 1 : 0) - ((opte & PTE_P) ? 1 : 0);
515 int wired_diff = ((npte & PG_W) ? 1 : 0) - ((opte & PG_W) ? 1 : 0);
516
517 KASSERT((npte & (PTE_P | PG_W)) != PG_W);
518 KASSERT((opte & (PTE_P | PG_W)) != PG_W);
519
520 pmap_stats_update(pmap, resid_diff, wired_diff);
521}
522
523/*
524 * ptp_to_pmap: lookup pmap by ptp
525 */
526static struct pmap *
527ptp_to_pmap(struct vm_page *ptp)
528{
529 struct pmap *pmap;
530
531 if (ptp == NULL) {
532 return pmap_kernel();
533 }
534 pmap = (struct pmap *)ptp->uobject;
535 KASSERT(pmap != NULL);
536 KASSERT(&pmap->pm_obj[0] == ptp->uobject);
537 return pmap;
538}
539
540static inline struct pv_pte *
541pve_to_pvpte(struct pv_entry *pve)
542{
543
544 KASSERT((void *)&pve->pve_pte == (void *)pve);
545 return &pve->pve_pte;
546}
547
548static inline struct pv_entry *
549pvpte_to_pve(struct pv_pte *pvpte)
550{
551 struct pv_entry *pve = (void *)pvpte;
552
553 KASSERT(pve_to_pvpte(pve) == pvpte);
554 return pve;
555}
556
557/*
558 * pv_pte_first, pv_pte_next: PV list iterator.
559 */
560static struct pv_pte *
561pv_pte_first(struct pmap_page *pp)
562{
563
564 if ((pp->pp_flags & PP_EMBEDDED) != 0) {
565 return &pp->pp_pte;
566 }
567 return pve_to_pvpte(LIST_FIRST(&pp->pp_head.pvh_list));
568}
569
570static struct pv_pte *
571pv_pte_next(struct pmap_page *pp, struct pv_pte *pvpte)
572{
573
574 KASSERT(pvpte != NULL);
575 if (pvpte == &pp->pp_pte) {
576 KASSERT((pp->pp_flags & PP_EMBEDDED) != 0);
577 return NULL;
578 }
579 KASSERT((pp->pp_flags & PP_EMBEDDED) == 0);
580 return pve_to_pvpte(LIST_NEXT(pvpte_to_pve(pvpte), pve_list));
581}
582
583/*
584 * pmap_is_curpmap: is this pmap the one currently loaded [in %cr3]?
585 * of course the kernel is always loaded
586 */
587bool
588pmap_is_curpmap(struct pmap *pmap)
589{
590 return ((pmap == pmap_kernel()) || (pmap == curcpu()->ci_pmap));
591}
592
593void
594pmap_reference(struct pmap *pmap)
595{
596
597 atomic_inc_uint(&pmap->pm_obj[0].uo_refs);
598}
599
600/*
601 * pmap_map_ptes: map a pmap's PTEs into KVM and lock them in
602 *
603 * there are several pmaps involved. some or all of them might be same.
604 *
605 * - the pmap given by the first argument
606 * our caller wants to access this pmap's PTEs.
607 *
608 * - pmap_kernel()
609 * the kernel pmap. note that it only contains the kernel part
610 * of the address space which is shared by any pmap. ie. any
611 * pmap can be used instead of pmap_kernel() for our purpose.
612 *
613 * - ci->ci_pmap
614 * pmap currently loaded on the cpu.
615 *
616 * - vm_map_pmap(&curproc->p_vmspace->vm_map)
617 * current process' pmap.
618 *
619 * => we lock enough pmaps to keep things locked in
620 * => must be undone with pmap_unmap_ptes before returning
621 */
622void
623pmap_map_ptes(struct pmap *pmap, struct pmap **pmap2, pd_entry_t **ptepp,
624 pd_entry_t * const **pdeppp)
625{
626 struct pmap *curpmap;
627 struct cpu_info *ci;
628 lwp_t *l;
629
630 /* The kernel's pmap is always accessible. */
631 if (pmap == pmap_kernel()) {
632 *pmap2 = NULL;
633 *ptepp = PTE_BASE;
634 *pdeppp = normal_pdes;
635 return;
636 }
637 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
638
639 l = curlwp;
640 retry:
641 mutex_enter(pmap->pm_lock);
642 ci = curcpu();
643 curpmap = ci->ci_pmap;
644 if (vm_map_pmap(&l->l_proc->p_vmspace->vm_map) == pmap) {
645 /* Our own pmap so just load it: easy. */
646 if (__predict_false(ci->ci_want_pmapload)) {
647 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
648 pmap_load();
649 goto retry;
650 }
651 KASSERT(pmap == curpmap);
652 } else if (pmap == curpmap) {
653 /*
654 * Already on the CPU: make it valid. This is very
655 * often the case during exit(), when we have switched
656 * to the kernel pmap in order to destroy a user pmap.
657 */
658 pmap_reactivate(pmap);
659 } else {
660 /*
661 * Toss current pmap from CPU, but keep a reference to it.
662 * The reference will be dropped by pmap_unmap_ptes().
663 * Can happen if we block during exit().
664 */
665 const cpuid_t cid = cpu_index(ci);
666
667 kcpuset_atomic_clear(curpmap->pm_cpus, cid);
668 kcpuset_atomic_clear(curpmap->pm_kernel_cpus, cid);
669 ci->ci_pmap = pmap;
670 ci->ci_tlbstate = TLBSTATE_VALID;
671 kcpuset_atomic_set(pmap->pm_cpus, cid);
672 kcpuset_atomic_set(pmap->pm_kernel_cpus, cid);
673 cpu_load_pmap(pmap, curpmap);
674 }
675 pmap->pm_ncsw = l->l_ncsw;
676 *pmap2 = curpmap;
677 *ptepp = PTE_BASE;
678
679#if defined(XENPV) && defined(__x86_64__)
680 KASSERT(ci->ci_normal_pdes[PTP_LEVELS - 2] == L4_BASE);
681 ci->ci_normal_pdes[PTP_LEVELS - 2] = pmap->pm_pdir;
682 *pdeppp = ci->ci_normal_pdes;
683#else
684 *pdeppp = normal_pdes;
685#endif
686}
687
688/*
689 * pmap_unmap_ptes: unlock the PTE mapping of "pmap"
690 */
691void
692pmap_unmap_ptes(struct pmap *pmap, struct pmap *pmap2)
693{
694 struct cpu_info *ci;
695 struct pmap *mypmap;
696
697 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
698
699 /* The kernel's pmap is always accessible. */
700 if (pmap == pmap_kernel()) {
701 return;
702 }
703
704 ci = curcpu();
705
706#if defined(XENPV) && defined(__x86_64__)
707 KASSERT(ci->ci_normal_pdes[PTP_LEVELS - 2] != L4_BASE);
708 ci->ci_normal_pdes[PTP_LEVELS - 2] = L4_BASE;
709#endif
710
711 /*
712 * We cannot tolerate context switches while mapped in.
713 * If it is our own pmap all we have to do is unlock.
714 */
715 KASSERT(pmap->pm_ncsw == curlwp->l_ncsw);
716 mypmap = vm_map_pmap(&curproc->p_vmspace->vm_map);
717 if (pmap == mypmap) {
718 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
719 return;
720 }
721
722 /*
723 * Mark whatever's on the CPU now as lazy and unlock.
724 * If the pmap was already installed, we are done.
725 */
726 ci->ci_tlbstate = TLBSTATE_LAZY;
727 ci->ci_want_pmapload = (mypmap != pmap_kernel());
728 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
729 if (pmap == pmap2) {
730 return;
731 }
732
733 /*
734 * We installed another pmap on the CPU. Grab a reference to
735 * it and leave in place. Toss the evicted pmap (can block).
736 */
737 pmap_reference(pmap);
738 pmap_destroy(pmap2);
739}
740
741inline static void
742pmap_exec_account(struct pmap *pm, vaddr_t va, pt_entry_t opte, pt_entry_t npte)
743{
744
745#if !defined(__x86_64__)
746 if (curproc == NULL || curproc->p_vmspace == NULL ||
747 pm != vm_map_pmap(&curproc->p_vmspace->vm_map))
748 return;
749
750 if ((opte ^ npte) & PG_X)
751 pmap_update_pg(va);
752
753 /*
754 * Executability was removed on the last executable change.
755 * Reset the code segment to something conservative and
756 * let the trap handler deal with setting the right limit.
757 * We can't do that because of locking constraints on the vm map.
758 */
759
760 if ((opte & PG_X) && (npte & PG_X) == 0 && va == pm->pm_hiexec) {
761 struct trapframe *tf = curlwp->l_md.md_regs;
762
763 tf->tf_cs = GSEL(GUCODE_SEL, SEL_UPL);
764 pm->pm_hiexec = I386_MAX_EXE_ADDR;
765 }
766#endif /* !defined(__x86_64__) */
767}
768
769#if !defined(__x86_64__)
770/*
771 * Fixup the code segment to cover all potential executable mappings.
772 * returns 0 if no changes to the code segment were made.
773 */
774int
775pmap_exec_fixup(struct vm_map *map, struct trapframe *tf, struct pcb *pcb)
776{
777 struct vm_map_entry *ent;
778 struct pmap *pm = vm_map_pmap(map);
779 vaddr_t va = 0;
780
781 vm_map_lock_read(map);
782 for (ent = (&map->header)->next; ent != &map->header; ent = ent->next) {
783 /*
784 * This entry has greater va than the entries before.
785 * We need to make it point to the last page, not past it.
786 */
787 if (ent->protection & VM_PROT_EXECUTE)
788 va = trunc_page(ent->end) - PAGE_SIZE;
789 }
790 vm_map_unlock_read(map);
791 if (va == pm->pm_hiexec && tf->tf_cs == GSEL(GUCODEBIG_SEL, SEL_UPL))
792 return 0;
793
794 pm->pm_hiexec = va;
795 if (pm->pm_hiexec > I386_MAX_EXE_ADDR) {
796 tf->tf_cs = GSEL(GUCODEBIG_SEL, SEL_UPL);
797 } else {
798 tf->tf_cs = GSEL(GUCODE_SEL, SEL_UPL);
799 return 0;
800 }
801 return 1;
802}
803#endif /* !defined(__x86_64__) */
804
805void
806pat_init(struct cpu_info *ci)
807{
808 uint64_t pat;
809
810 if (!(ci->ci_feat_val[0] & CPUID_PAT))
811 return;
812
813 /* We change WT to WC. Leave all other entries the default values. */
814 pat = PATENTRY(0, PAT_WB) | PATENTRY(1, PAT_WC) |
815 PATENTRY(2, PAT_UCMINUS) | PATENTRY(3, PAT_UC) |
816 PATENTRY(4, PAT_WB) | PATENTRY(5, PAT_WC) |
817 PATENTRY(6, PAT_UCMINUS) | PATENTRY(7, PAT_UC);
818
819 wrmsr(MSR_CR_PAT, pat);
820 cpu_pat_enabled = true;
821 aprint_debug_dev(ci->ci_dev, "PAT enabled\n");
822}
823
824static pt_entry_t
825pmap_pat_flags(u_int flags)
826{
827 u_int cacheflags = (flags & PMAP_CACHE_MASK);
828
829 if (!cpu_pat_enabled) {
830 switch (cacheflags) {
831 case PMAP_NOCACHE:
832 case PMAP_NOCACHE_OVR:
833 /* results in PGC_UCMINUS on cpus which have
834 * the cpuid PAT but PAT "disabled"
835 */
836 return PTE_PCD;
837 default:
838 return 0;
839 }
840 }
841
842 switch (cacheflags) {
843 case PMAP_NOCACHE:
844 return PGC_UC;
845 case PMAP_WRITE_COMBINE:
846 return PGC_WC;
847 case PMAP_WRITE_BACK:
848 return PGC_WB;
849 case PMAP_NOCACHE_OVR:
850 return PGC_UCMINUS;
851 }
852
853 return 0;
854}
855
856/*
857 * p m a p k e n t e r f u n c t i o n s
858 *
859 * functions to quickly enter/remove pages from the kernel address
860 * space. pmap_kremove is exported to MI kernel. we make use of
861 * the recursive PTE mappings.
862 */
863
864/*
865 * pmap_kenter_pa: enter a kernel mapping without R/M (pv_entry) tracking
866 *
867 * => no need to lock anything, assume va is already allocated
868 * => should be faster than normal pmap enter function
869 */
870void
871pmap_kenter_pa(vaddr_t va, paddr_t pa, vm_prot_t prot, u_int flags)
872{
873 pt_entry_t *pte, opte, npte;
874
875 KASSERT(!(prot & ~VM_PROT_ALL));
876
877 if (va < VM_MIN_KERNEL_ADDRESS)
878 pte = vtopte(va);
879 else
880 pte = kvtopte(va);
881#ifdef DOM0OPS
882 if (pa < pmap_pa_start || pa >= pmap_pa_end) {
883#ifdef DEBUG
884 printf_nolog("%s: pa %#" PRIxPADDR " for va %#" PRIxVADDR
885 " outside range\n", __func__, pa, va);
886#endif /* DEBUG */
887 npte = pa;
888 } else
889#endif /* DOM0OPS */
890 npte = pmap_pa2pte(pa);
891 npte |= protection_codes[prot] | PTE_P | pmap_pg_g;
892 npte |= pmap_pat_flags(flags);
893 opte = pmap_pte_testset(pte, npte); /* zap! */
894
895 /*
896 * XXX: make sure we are not dealing with a large page, since the only
897 * large pages created are for the kernel image, and they should never
898 * be kentered.
899 */
900 KASSERTMSG(!(opte & PTE_PS), "PTE_PS va=%#"PRIxVADDR, va);
901
902 if ((opte & (PTE_P | PTE_A)) == (PTE_P | PTE_A)) {
903 /* This should not happen. */
904 printf_nolog("%s: mapping already present\n", __func__);
905 kpreempt_disable();
906 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap_kernel(), va, opte, TLBSHOOT_KENTER);
907 kpreempt_enable();
908 }
909}
910
911__strict_weak_alias(pmap_kenter_ma, pmap_kenter_pa);
912
913#if defined(__x86_64__)
914/*
915 * Change protection for a virtual address. Local for a CPU only, don't
916 * care about TLB shootdowns.
917 *
918 * => must be called with preemption disabled
919 */
920void
921pmap_changeprot_local(vaddr_t va, vm_prot_t prot)
922{
923 pt_entry_t *pte, opte, npte;
924
925 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
926
927 if (va < VM_MIN_KERNEL_ADDRESS)
928 pte = vtopte(va);
929 else
930 pte = kvtopte(va);
931
932 npte = opte = *pte;
933
934 if ((prot & VM_PROT_WRITE) != 0)
935 npte |= PTE_W;
936 else
937 npte &= ~PTE_W;
938
939 if (opte != npte) {
940 pmap_pte_set(pte, npte);
941 pmap_pte_flush();
942 invlpg(va);
943 }
944}
945#endif /* defined(__x86_64__) */
946
947/*
948 * pmap_kremove: remove a kernel mapping(s) without R/M (pv_entry) tracking
949 *
950 * => no need to lock anything
951 * => caller must dispose of any vm_page mapped in the va range
952 * => note: not an inline function
953 * => we assume the va is page aligned and the len is a multiple of PAGE_SIZE
954 * => we assume kernel only unmaps valid addresses and thus don't bother
955 * checking the valid bit before doing TLB flushing
956 * => must be followed by call to pmap_update() before reuse of page
957 */
958static inline void
959pmap_kremove1(vaddr_t sva, vsize_t len, bool localonly)
960{
961 pt_entry_t *pte, opte;
962 vaddr_t va, eva;
963
964 eva = sva + len;
965
966 kpreempt_disable();
967 for (va = sva; va < eva; va += PAGE_SIZE) {
968 pte = kvtopte(va);
969 opte = pmap_pte_testset(pte, 0); /* zap! */
970 if ((opte & (PTE_P | PTE_A)) == (PTE_P | PTE_A) && !localonly) {
971 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap_kernel(), va, opte,
972 TLBSHOOT_KREMOVE);
973 }
974 KASSERTMSG((opte & PTE_PS) == 0,
975 "va %#" PRIxVADDR " is a large page", va);
976 KASSERTMSG((opte & PG_PVLIST) == 0,
977 "va %#" PRIxVADDR " is a pv tracked page", va);
978 }
979 if (localonly) {
980 tlbflushg();
981 }
982 kpreempt_enable();
983}
984
985void
986pmap_kremove(vaddr_t sva, vsize_t len)
987{
988
989 pmap_kremove1(sva, len, false);
990}
991
992/*
993 * pmap_kremove_local: like pmap_kremove(), but only worry about
994 * TLB invalidations on the current CPU. this is only intended
995 * for use while writing kernel crash dumps, either after panic
996 * or via reboot -d.
997 */
998void
999pmap_kremove_local(vaddr_t sva, vsize_t len)
1000{
1001
1002 pmap_kremove1(sva, len, true);
1003}
1004
1005/*
1006 * p m a p i n i t f u n c t i o n s
1007 *
1008 * pmap_bootstrap and pmap_init are called during system startup
1009 * to init the pmap module. pmap_bootstrap() does a low level
1010 * init just to get things rolling. pmap_init() finishes the job.
1011 */
1012
1013/*
1014 * pmap_bootstrap_valloc: allocate a virtual address in the bootstrap area.
1015 * This function is to be used before any VM system has been set up.
1016 *
1017 * The va is taken from virtual_avail.
1018 */
1019static vaddr_t
1020pmap_bootstrap_valloc(size_t npages)
1021{
1022 vaddr_t va = virtual_avail;
1023 virtual_avail += npages * PAGE_SIZE;
1024 return va;
1025}
1026
1027/*
1028 * pmap_bootstrap_palloc: allocate a physical address in the bootstrap area.
1029 * This function is to be used before any VM system has been set up.
1030 *
1031 * The pa is taken from avail_start.
1032 */
1033static paddr_t
1034pmap_bootstrap_palloc(size_t npages)
1035{
1036 paddr_t pa = avail_start;
1037 avail_start += npages * PAGE_SIZE;
1038 return pa;
1039}
1040
1041/*
1042 * pmap_bootstrap: get the system in a state where it can run with VM properly
1043 * enabled (called before main()). The VM system is fully init'd later.
1044 *
1045 * => on i386, locore.S has already enabled the MMU by allocating a PDP for the
1046 * kernel, and nkpde PTP's for the kernel.
1047 * => kva_start is the first free virtual address in kernel space.
1048 */
1049void
1050pmap_bootstrap(vaddr_t kva_start)
1051{
1052 struct pmap *kpm;
1053 int i;
1054 vaddr_t kva;
1055
1056 pmap_pg_nx = (cpu_feature[2] & CPUID_NOX ? PTE_NX : 0);
1057
1058 /*
1059 * Set up our local static global vars that keep track of the usage of
1060 * KVM before kernel_map is set up.
1061 */
1062 virtual_avail = kva_start; /* first free KVA */
1063 virtual_end = VM_MAX_KERNEL_ADDRESS; /* last KVA */
1064
1065 /*
1066 * Set up protection_codes: we need to be able to convert from a MI
1067 * protection code (some combo of VM_PROT...) to something we can jam
1068 * into a x86 PTE.
1069 */
1070 protection_codes[VM_PROT_NONE] = pmap_pg_nx;
1071 protection_codes[VM_PROT_EXECUTE] = PG_X;
1072 protection_codes[VM_PROT_READ] = pmap_pg_nx;
1073 protection_codes[VM_PROT_READ|VM_PROT_EXECUTE] = PG_X;
1074 protection_codes[VM_PROT_WRITE] = PTE_W | pmap_pg_nx;
1075 protection_codes[VM_PROT_WRITE|VM_PROT_EXECUTE] = PTE_W | PG_X;
1076 protection_codes[VM_PROT_WRITE|VM_PROT_READ] = PTE_W | pmap_pg_nx;
1077 protection_codes[VM_PROT_ALL] = PTE_W | PG_X;
1078
1079 /*
1080 * Now we init the kernel's pmap.
1081 *
1082 * The kernel pmap's pm_obj is not used for much. However, in user pmaps
1083 * the pm_obj contains the list of active PTPs.
1084 *
1085 * The pm_obj currently does not have a pager. It might be possible to
1086 * add a pager that would allow a process to read-only mmap its own page
1087 * tables (fast user-level vtophys?). This may or may not be useful.
1088 */
1089 kpm = pmap_kernel();
1090 for (i = 0; i < PTP_LEVELS - 1; i++) {
1091 mutex_init(&kpm->pm_obj_lock[i], MUTEX_DEFAULT, IPL_NONE);
1092 uvm_obj_init(&kpm->pm_obj[i], NULL, false, 1);
1093 uvm_obj_setlock(&kpm->pm_obj[i], &kpm->pm_obj_lock[i]);
1094 kpm->pm_ptphint[i] = NULL;
1095 }
1096 memset(&kpm->pm_list, 0, sizeof(kpm->pm_list)); /* pm_list not used */
1097
1098 kpm->pm_pdir = (pd_entry_t *)bootspace.pdir;
1099 for (i = 0; i < PDP_SIZE; i++)
1100 kpm->pm_pdirpa[i] = PDPpaddr + PAGE_SIZE * i;
1101
1102 kpm->pm_stats.wired_count = kpm->pm_stats.resident_count =
1103 x86_btop(kva_start - VM_MIN_KERNEL_ADDRESS);
1104
1105 kcpuset_create(&kpm->pm_cpus, true);
1106 kcpuset_create(&kpm->pm_kernel_cpus, true);
1107
1108 kpm->pm_ldt = NULL;
1109 kpm->pm_ldt_len = 0;
1110 kpm->pm_ldt_sel = GSYSSEL(GLDT_SEL, SEL_KPL);
1111
1112 /*
1113 * the above is just a rough estimate and not critical to the proper
1114 * operation of the system.
1115 */
1116
1117#if !defined(XENPV)
1118 /*
1119 * Begin to enable global TLB entries if they are supported: add PTE_G
1120 * attribute to already mapped kernel pages. Do that only if SVS is
1121 * disabled.
1122 *
1123 * The G bit has no effect until the CR4_PGE bit is set in CR4, which
1124 * happens later in cpu_init().
1125 */
1126#ifdef SVS
1127 if (!svs_enabled && (cpu_feature[0] & CPUID_PGE)) {
1128#else
1129 if (cpu_feature[0] & CPUID_PGE) {
1130#endif
1131 pmap_pg_g = PTE_G;
1132 pmap_remap_global();
1133 }
1134#endif
1135
1136#ifndef XENPV
1137 /*
1138 * Enable large pages if they are supported.
1139 */
1140 if (cpu_feature[0] & CPUID_PSE) {
1141 lcr4(rcr4() | CR4_PSE); /* enable hardware (via %cr4) */
1142 pmap_largepages = 1; /* enable software */
1143
1144 /*
1145 * The TLB must be flushed after enabling large pages on Pentium
1146 * CPUs, according to section 3.6.2.2 of "Intel Architecture
1147 * Software Developer's Manual, Volume 3: System Programming".
1148 */
1149 tlbflushg();
1150
1151 /* Remap the kernel. */
1152 pmap_remap_largepages();
1153 }
1154 pmap_init_lapic();
1155#endif /* !XENPV */
1156
1157#ifdef __HAVE_PCPU_AREA
1158 pmap_init_pcpu();
1159#endif
1160
1161#ifdef __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP
1162 pmap_init_directmap(kpm);
1163#else
1164 pmap_vpage_cpualloc(&cpu_info_primary);
1165
1166 if (VM_MIN_KERNEL_ADDRESS == KERNBASE) { /* i386 */
1167 early_zerop = (void *)cpu_info_primary.vpage[VPAGE_ZER];
1168 early_zero_pte = cpu_info_primary.vpage_pte[VPAGE_ZER];
1169 } else { /* amd64 */
1170 /*
1171 * zero_pte is stuck at the end of mapped space for the kernel
1172 * image (disjunct from kva space). This is done so that it
1173 * can safely be used in pmap_growkernel (pmap_get_physpage),
1174 * when it's called for the first time.
1175 * XXXfvdl fix this for MULTIPROCESSOR later.
1176 */
1177#ifdef XENPV
1178 /* early_zerop initialized in xen_locore() */
1179#else
1180 early_zerop = (void *)bootspace.spareva;
1181#endif
1182 early_zero_pte = PTE_BASE + pl1_i((vaddr_t)early_zerop);
1183 }
1184#endif
1185
1186#if defined(XENPV) && defined(__x86_64__)
1187 extern vaddr_t xen_dummy_page;
1188 paddr_t xen_dummy_user_pgd;
1189
1190 /*
1191 * We want a dummy page directory for Xen: when deactivating a pmap,
1192 * Xen will still consider it active. So we set user PGD to this one
1193 * to lift all protection on the now inactive page tables set.
1194 */
1195 xen_dummy_user_pgd = xen_dummy_page - KERNBASE;
1196
1197 /* Zero fill it, the less checks in Xen it requires the better */
1198 memset((void *)(xen_dummy_user_pgd + KERNBASE), 0, PAGE_SIZE);
1199 /* Mark read-only */
1200 HYPERVISOR_update_va_mapping(xen_dummy_user_pgd + KERNBASE,
1201 pmap_pa2pte(xen_dummy_user_pgd) | PTE_P | pmap_pg_nx,
1202 UVMF_INVLPG);
1203 /* Pin as L4 */
1204 xpq_queue_pin_l4_table(xpmap_ptom_masked(xen_dummy_user_pgd));
1205#endif
1206
1207 /*
1208 * Allocate space for the IDT, GDT and LDT.
1209 */
1210#ifdef __HAVE_PCPU_AREA
1211 idt_vaddr = (vaddr_t)&pcpuarea->idt;
1212#else
1213 idt_vaddr = pmap_bootstrap_valloc(1);
1214#endif
1215 idt_paddr = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1216
1217 gdt_vaddr = pmap_bootstrap_valloc(1);
1218 gdt_paddr = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1219
1220#ifdef __HAVE_PCPU_AREA
1221 ldt_vaddr = (vaddr_t)&pcpuarea->ldt;
1222#else
1223 ldt_vaddr = pmap_bootstrap_valloc(1);
1224#endif
1225 ldt_paddr = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1226
1227#if !defined(__x86_64__)
1228 /* pentium f00f bug stuff */
1229 pentium_idt_vaddr = pmap_bootstrap_valloc(1);
1230#endif
1231
1232#if defined(XENPVHVM)
1233 /* XXX: move to hypervisor.c with appropriate API adjustments */
1234 extern paddr_t HYPERVISOR_shared_info_pa;
1235 extern volatile struct xencons_interface *xencons_interface; /* XXX */
1236 extern struct xenstore_domain_interface *xenstore_interface; /* XXX */
1237
1238 HYPERVISOR_shared_info = (void *) pmap_bootstrap_valloc(1);
1239 HYPERVISOR_shared_info_pa = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1240 xencons_interface = (void *) pmap_bootstrap_valloc(1);
1241 xenstore_interface = (void *) pmap_bootstrap_valloc(1);
1242#endif
1243 /*
1244 * Now we reserve some VM for mapping pages when doing a crash dump.
1245 */
1246 virtual_avail = reserve_dumppages(virtual_avail);
1247
1248 /*
1249 * Init the static-global locks and global lists.
1250 *
1251 * => pventry::pvh_lock (initialized elsewhere) must also be
1252 * a spin lock, again at IPL_VM to prevent deadlock, and
1253 * again is never taken from interrupt context.
1254 */
1255 mutex_init(&pmaps_lock, MUTEX_DEFAULT, IPL_NONE);
1256 LIST_INIT(&pmaps);
1257
1258 /*
1259 * Ensure the TLB is sync'd with reality by flushing it...
1260 */
1261 tlbflushg();
1262
1263 /*
1264 * Calculate pmap_maxkvaddr from nkptp[].
1265 */
1266 kva = VM_MIN_KERNEL_ADDRESS;
1267 for (i = PTP_LEVELS - 1; i >= 1; i--) {
1268 kva += nkptp[i] * nbpd[i];
1269 }
1270 pmap_maxkvaddr = kva;
1271}
1272
1273#ifndef XENPV
1274static void
1275pmap_init_lapic(void)
1276{
1277 /*
1278 * On CPUs that have no LAPIC, local_apic_va is never kentered. But our
1279 * x86 implementation relies a lot on this address to be valid; so just
1280 * allocate a fake physical page that will be kentered into
1281 * local_apic_va by machdep.
1282 *
1283 * If the LAPIC is present, the va will be remapped somewhere else
1284 * later in lapic_map.
1285 */
1286 local_apic_va = pmap_bootstrap_valloc(1);
1287 local_apic_pa = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1288}
1289#endif
1290
1291#ifdef __x86_64__
1292static size_t
1293pmap_pagetree_nentries_range(vaddr_t startva, vaddr_t endva, size_t pgsz)
1294{
1295 size_t npages;
1296 npages = (roundup(endva, pgsz) / pgsz) -
1297 (rounddown(startva, pgsz) / pgsz);
1298 return npages;
1299}
1300#endif
1301
1302#if defined(__HAVE_DIRECT_MAP) || defined(KASAN)
1303static inline void
1304slotspace_copy(int type, pd_entry_t *dst, pd_entry_t *src)
1305{
1306 size_t sslot = slotspace.area[type].sslot;
1307 size_t nslot = slotspace.area[type].nslot;
1308
1309 memcpy(&dst[sslot], &src[sslot], nslot * sizeof(pd_entry_t));
1310}
1311#endif
1312
1313#ifdef __x86_64__
1314/*
1315 * Randomize the location of an area. We count the holes in the VM space. We
1316 * randomly select one hole, and then randomly select an area within that hole.
1317 * Finally we update the associated entry in the slotspace structure.
1318 */
1319vaddr_t __noasan
1320slotspace_rand(int type, size_t sz, size_t align)
1321{
1322 struct {
1323 int start;
1324 int end;
1325 } holes[SLSPACE_NAREAS+1];
1326 size_t i, nholes, hole;
1327 size_t startsl, endsl, nslots, winsize;
1328 vaddr_t startva, va;
1329
1330 sz = roundup(sz, align);
1331 nslots = roundup(sz+NBPD_L4, NBPD_L4) / NBPD_L4;
1332
1333 /* Get the holes. */
1334 nholes = 0;
1335 size_t curslot = 0 + 256; /* end of SLAREA_USER */
1336 while (1) {
1337 /*
1338 * Find the first occupied slot after the current one.
1339 * The area between the two is a hole.
1340 */
1341 size_t minsslot = 512;
1342 size_t minnslot = 0;
1343 for (i = 0; i < SLSPACE_NAREAS; i++) {
1344 if (!slotspace.area[i].active)
1345 continue;
1346 if (slotspace.area[i].sslot >= curslot &&
1347 slotspace.area[i].sslot < minsslot) {
1348 minsslot = slotspace.area[i].sslot;
1349 minnslot = slotspace.area[i].nslot;
1350 }
1351 }
1352 if (minsslot == 512) {
1353 break;
1354 }
1355
1356 if (minsslot - curslot >= nslots) {
1357 holes[nholes].start = curslot;
1358 holes[nholes].end = minsslot;
1359 nholes++;
1360 }
1361
1362 curslot = minsslot + minnslot;
1363 }
1364
1365 if (nholes == 0) {
1366 panic("%s: impossible", __func__);
1367 }
1368
1369 /* Select a hole. */
1370 cpu_earlyrng(&hole, sizeof(hole));
1371#ifdef NO_X86_ASLR
1372 hole = 0;
1373#endif
1374 hole %= nholes;
1375 startsl = holes[hole].start;
1376 endsl = holes[hole].end;
1377 startva = VA_SIGN_NEG(startsl * NBPD_L4);
1378
1379 /* Select an area within the hole. */
1380 cpu_earlyrng(&va, sizeof(va));
1381#ifdef NO_X86_ASLR
1382 va = 0;
1383#endif
1384 winsize = ((endsl - startsl) * NBPD_L4) - sz;
1385 va %= winsize;
1386 va = rounddown(va, align);
1387 va += startva;
1388
1389 /* Update the entry. */
1390 slotspace.area[type].sslot = pl4_i(va);
1391 slotspace.area[type].nslot =
1392 pmap_pagetree_nentries_range(va, va+sz, NBPD_L4);
1393 slotspace.area[type].active = true;
1394
1395 return va;
1396}
1397#endif
1398
1399#ifdef __HAVE_PCPU_AREA
1400static void
1401pmap_init_pcpu(void)
1402{
1403 const vaddr_t startva = PMAP_PCPU_BASE;
1404 size_t nL4e, nL3e, nL2e, nL1e;
1405 size_t L4e_idx, L3e_idx, L2e_idx, L1e_idx __diagused;
1406 paddr_t pa;
1407 vaddr_t endva;
1408 vaddr_t tmpva;
1409 pt_entry_t *pte;
1410 size_t size;
1411 int i;
1412
1413 const pd_entry_t pteflags = PTE_P | PTE_W | pmap_pg_nx;
1414
1415 size = sizeof(struct pcpu_area);
1416
1417 endva = startva + size;
1418
1419 /* We will use this temporary va. */
1420 tmpva = bootspace.spareva;
1421 pte = PTE_BASE + pl1_i(tmpva);
1422
1423 /* Build L4 */
1424 L4e_idx = pl4_i(startva);
1425 nL4e = pmap_pagetree_nentries_range(startva, endva, NBPD_L4);
1426 KASSERT(nL4e == 1);
1427 for (i = 0; i < nL4e; i++) {
1428 KASSERT(L4_BASE[L4e_idx+i] == 0);
1429
1430 pa = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1431 *pte = (pa & PTE_FRAME) | pteflags;
1432 pmap_update_pg(tmpva);
1433 memset((void *)tmpva, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
1434
1435 L4_BASE[L4e_idx+i] = pa | pteflags | PTE_A;
1436 }
1437
1438 /* Build L3 */
1439 L3e_idx = pl3_i(startva);
1440 nL3e = pmap_pagetree_nentries_range(startva, endva, NBPD_L3);
1441 for (i = 0; i < nL3e; i++) {
1442 KASSERT(L3_BASE[L3e_idx+i] == 0);
1443
1444 pa = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1445 *pte = (pa & PTE_FRAME) | pteflags;
1446 pmap_update_pg(tmpva);
1447 memset((void *)tmpva, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
1448
1449 L3_BASE[L3e_idx+i] = pa | pteflags | PTE_A;
1450 }
1451
1452 /* Build L2 */
1453 L2e_idx = pl2_i(startva);
1454 nL2e = pmap_pagetree_nentries_range(startva, endva, NBPD_L2);
1455 for (i = 0; i < nL2e; i++) {
1456
1457 KASSERT(L2_BASE[L2e_idx+i] == 0);
1458
1459 pa = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1460 *pte = (pa & PTE_FRAME) | pteflags;
1461 pmap_update_pg(tmpva);
1462 memset((void *)tmpva, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
1463
1464 L2_BASE[L2e_idx+i] = pa | pteflags | PTE_A;
1465 }
1466
1467 /* Build L1 */
1468 L1e_idx = pl1_i(startva);
1469 nL1e = pmap_pagetree_nentries_range(startva, endva, NBPD_L1);
1470 for (i = 0; i < nL1e; i++) {
1471 /*
1472 * Nothing to do, the PTEs will be entered via
1473 * pmap_kenter_pa.
1474 */
1475 KASSERT(L1_BASE[L1e_idx+i] == 0);
1476 }
1477
1478 *pte = 0;
1479 pmap_update_pg(tmpva);
1480
1481 pcpuarea = (struct pcpu_area *)startva;
1482
1483 tlbflush();
1484}
1485#endif
1486
1487#ifdef __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP
1488/*
1489 * Create the amd64 direct map. Called only once at boot time. We map all of
1490 * the physical memory contiguously using 2MB large pages, with RW permissions.
1491 * However there is a hole: the kernel is mapped with RO permissions.
1492 */
1493static void
1494pmap_init_directmap(struct pmap *kpm)
1495{
1496 extern phys_ram_seg_t mem_clusters[];
1497 extern int mem_cluster_cnt;
1498
1499 vaddr_t startva;
1500 size_t nL4e, nL3e, nL2e;
1501 size_t L4e_idx, L3e_idx, L2e_idx;
1502 size_t spahole, epahole;
1503 paddr_t lastpa, pa;
1504 vaddr_t endva;
1505 vaddr_t tmpva;
1506 pt_entry_t *pte;
1507 phys_ram_seg_t *mc;
1508 int i;
1509
1510 const pd_entry_t pteflags = PTE_P | PTE_W | pmap_pg_nx;
1511 const pd_entry_t holepteflags = PTE_P | pmap_pg_nx;
1512
1513 CTASSERT(NL4_SLOT_DIRECT * NBPD_L4 == MAXPHYSMEM);
1514
1515 spahole = roundup(bootspace.head.pa, NBPD_L2);
1516 epahole = rounddown(bootspace.boot.pa, NBPD_L2);
1517
1518 /* Get the last physical address available */
1519 lastpa = 0;
1520 for (i = 0; i < mem_cluster_cnt; i++) {
1521 mc = &mem_clusters[i];
1522 lastpa = MAX(lastpa, mc->start + mc->size);
1523 }
1524
1525 /*
1526 * x86_add_cluster should have truncated the memory to MAXPHYSMEM.
1527 */
1528 if (lastpa > MAXPHYSMEM) {
1529 panic("pmap_init_directmap: lastpa incorrect");
1530 }
1531
1532 startva = slotspace_rand(SLAREA_DMAP, lastpa, NBPD_L2);
1533 endva = startva + lastpa;
1534
1535 /* We will use this temporary va. */
1536 tmpva = bootspace.spareva;
1537 pte = PTE_BASE + pl1_i(tmpva);
1538
1539 /* Build L4 */
1540 L4e_idx = pl4_i(startva);
1541 nL4e = pmap_pagetree_nentries_range(startva, endva, NBPD_L4);
1542 KASSERT(nL4e <= NL4_SLOT_DIRECT);
1543 for (i = 0; i < nL4e; i++) {
1544 KASSERT(L4_BASE[L4e_idx+i] == 0);
1545
1546 pa = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1547 *pte = (pa & PTE_FRAME) | pteflags;
1548 pmap_update_pg(tmpva);
1549 memset((void *)tmpva, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
1550
1551 L4_BASE[L4e_idx+i] = pa | pteflags | PTE_A;
1552 }
1553
1554 /* Build L3 */
1555 L3e_idx = pl3_i(startva);
1556 nL3e = pmap_pagetree_nentries_range(startva, endva, NBPD_L3);
1557 for (i = 0; i < nL3e; i++) {
1558 KASSERT(L3_BASE[L3e_idx+i] == 0);
1559
1560 pa = pmap_bootstrap_palloc(1);
1561 *pte = (pa & PTE_FRAME) | pteflags;
1562 pmap_update_pg(tmpva);
1563 memset((void *)tmpva, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
1564
1565 L3_BASE[L3e_idx+i] = pa | pteflags | PTE_A;
1566 }
1567
1568 /* Build L2 */
1569 L2e_idx = pl2_i(startva);
1570 nL2e = pmap_pagetree_nentries_range(startva, endva, NBPD_L2);
1571 for (i = 0; i < nL2e; i++) {
1572 KASSERT(L2_BASE[L2e_idx+i] == 0);
1573
1574 pa = (paddr_t)(i * NBPD_L2);
1575
1576 if (spahole <= pa && pa < epahole) {
1577 L2_BASE[L2e_idx+i] = pa | holepteflags | PTE_A |
1578 PTE_PS | pmap_pg_g;
1579 } else {
1580 L2_BASE[L2e_idx+i] = pa | pteflags | PTE_A |
1581 PTE_PS | pmap_pg_g;
1582 }
1583 }
1584
1585 *pte = 0;
1586 pmap_update_pg(tmpva);
1587
1588 pmap_direct_base = startva;
1589 pmap_direct_end = endva;
1590
1591 tlbflush();
1592}
1593#endif /* __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP */
1594
1595#if !defined(XENPV)
1596/*
1597 * Remap all of the virtual pages created so far with the PTE_G bit.
1598 */
1599static void
1600pmap_remap_global(void)
1601{
1602 vaddr_t kva, kva_end;
1603 unsigned long p1i;
1604 size_t i;
1605
1606 /* head */
1607 kva = bootspace.head.va;
1608 kva_end = kva + bootspace.head.sz;
1609 for ( ; kva < kva_end; kva += PAGE_SIZE) {
1610 p1i = pl1_i(kva);
1611 if (pmap_valid_entry(PTE_BASE[p1i]))
1612 PTE_BASE[p1i] |= pmap_pg_g;
1613 }
1614
1615 /* kernel segments */
1616 for (i = 0; i < BTSPACE_NSEGS; i++) {
1617 if (bootspace.segs[i].type == BTSEG_NONE) {
1618 continue;
1619 }
1620 kva = bootspace.segs[i].va;
1621 kva_end = kva + bootspace.segs[i].sz;
1622 for ( ; kva < kva_end; kva += PAGE_SIZE) {
1623 p1i = pl1_i(kva);
1624 if (pmap_valid_entry(PTE_BASE[p1i]))
1625 PTE_BASE[p1i] |= pmap_pg_g;
1626 }
1627 }
1628
1629 /* boot space */
1630 kva = bootspace.boot.va;
1631 kva_end = kva + bootspace.boot.sz;
1632 for ( ; kva < kva_end; kva += PAGE_SIZE) {
1633 p1i = pl1_i(kva);
1634 if (pmap_valid_entry(PTE_BASE[p1i]))
1635 PTE_BASE[p1i] |= pmap_pg_g;
1636 }
1637}
1638#endif
1639
1640#ifndef XENPV
1641/*
1642 * Remap several kernel segments with large pages. We cover as many pages as we
1643 * can. Called only once at boot time, if the CPU supports large pages.
1644 */
1645static void
1646pmap_remap_largepages(void)
1647{
1648 pd_entry_t *pde;
1649 vaddr_t kva, kva_end;
1650 paddr_t pa;
1651 size_t i;
1652
1653 /* Remap the kernel text using large pages. */
1654 for (i = 0; i < BTSPACE_NSEGS; i++) {
1655 if (bootspace.segs[i].type != BTSEG_TEXT) {
1656 continue;
1657 }
1658 kva = roundup(bootspace.segs[i].va, NBPD_L2);
1659 if (kva < bootspace.segs[i].va) {
1660 continue;
1661 }
1662 kva_end = rounddown(bootspace.segs[i].va +
1663 bootspace.segs[i].sz, NBPD_L2);
1664 pa = roundup(bootspace.segs[i].pa, NBPD_L2);
1665 for (/* */; kva < kva_end; kva += NBPD_L2, pa += NBPD_L2) {
1666 pde = &L2_BASE[pl2_i(kva)];
1667 *pde = pa | pmap_pg_g | PTE_PS | PTE_P;
1668 tlbflushg();
1669 }
1670 }
1671
1672 /* Remap the kernel rodata using large pages. */
1673 for (i = 0; i < BTSPACE_NSEGS; i++) {
1674 if (bootspace.segs[i].type != BTSEG_RODATA) {
1675 continue;
1676 }
1677 kva = roundup(bootspace.segs[i].va, NBPD_L2);
1678 if (kva < bootspace.segs[i].va) {
1679 continue;
1680 }
1681 kva_end = rounddown(bootspace.segs[i].va +
1682 bootspace.segs[i].sz, NBPD_L2);
1683 pa = roundup(bootspace.segs[i].pa, NBPD_L2);
1684 for (/* */; kva < kva_end; kva += NBPD_L2, pa += NBPD_L2) {
1685 pde = &L2_BASE[pl2_i(kva)];
1686 *pde = pa | pmap_pg_g | PTE_PS | pmap_pg_nx | PTE_P;
1687 tlbflushg();
1688 }
1689 }
1690
1691 /* Remap the kernel data+bss using large pages. */
1692 for (i = 0; i < BTSPACE_NSEGS; i++) {
1693 if (bootspace.segs[i].type != BTSEG_DATA) {
1694 continue;
1695 }
1696 kva = roundup(bootspace.segs[i].va, NBPD_L2);
1697 if (kva < bootspace.segs[i].va) {
1698 continue;
1699 }
1700 kva_end = rounddown(bootspace.segs[i].va +
1701 bootspace.segs[i].sz, NBPD_L2);
1702 pa = roundup(bootspace.segs[i].pa, NBPD_L2);
1703 for (/* */; kva < kva_end; kva += NBPD_L2, pa += NBPD_L2) {
1704 pde = &L2_BASE[pl2_i(kva)];
1705 *pde = pa | pmap_pg_g | PTE_PS | pmap_pg_nx | PTE_W | PTE_P;
1706 tlbflushg();
1707 }
1708 }
1709}
1710#endif /* !XENPV */
1711
1712/*
1713 * pmap_init: called from uvm_init, our job is to get the pmap system ready
1714 * to manage mappings.
1715 */
1716void
1717pmap_init(void)
1718{
1719 int i, flags;
1720
1721 for (i = 0; i < PV_HASH_SIZE; i++) {
1722 SLIST_INIT(&pv_hash_heads[i].hh_list);
1723 }
1724 for (i = 0; i < PV_HASH_LOCK_CNT; i++) {
1725 mutex_init(&pv_hash_locks[i].lock, MUTEX_NODEBUG, IPL_VM);
1726 }
1727
1728 /*
1729 * initialize caches.
1730 */
1731
1732 pool_cache_bootstrap(&pmap_cache, sizeof(struct pmap), 0, 0, 0,
1733 "pmappl", NULL, IPL_NONE, NULL, NULL, NULL);
1734
1735#ifdef XENPV
1736 /*
1737 * pool_cache(9) should not touch cached objects, since they
1738 * are pinned on xen and R/O for the domU
1739 */
1740 flags = PR_NOTOUCH;
1741#else
1742 flags = 0;
1743#endif
1744
1745#ifdef PAE
1746 pool_cache_bootstrap(&pmap_pdp_cache, PAGE_SIZE * PDP_SIZE, 0, 0, flags,
1747 "pdppl", &pmap_pdp_allocator, IPL_NONE,
1748 pmap_pdp_ctor, pmap_pdp_dtor, NULL);
1749#else
1750 pool_cache_bootstrap(&pmap_pdp_cache, PAGE_SIZE, 0, 0, flags,
1751 "pdppl", NULL, IPL_NONE, pmap_pdp_ctor, pmap_pdp_dtor, NULL);
1752#endif
1753 pool_cache_bootstrap(&pmap_pv_cache, sizeof(struct pv_entry), 0, 0,
1754 PR_LARGECACHE, "pvpl", &pool_allocator_kmem, IPL_NONE, NULL,
1755 NULL, NULL);
1756
1757 pmap_tlb_init();
1758
1759 /* XXX: Since cpu_hatch() is only for secondary CPUs. */
1760 pmap_tlb_cpu_init(curcpu());
1761
1762 evcnt_attach_dynamic(&pmap_iobmp_evcnt, EVCNT_TYPE_MISC,
1763 NULL, "x86", "io bitmap copy");
1764 evcnt_attach_dynamic(&pmap_ldt_evcnt, EVCNT_TYPE_MISC,
1765 NULL, "x86", "ldt sync");
1766
1767 /*
1768 * done: pmap module is up (and ready for business)
1769 */
1770
1771 pmap_initialized = true;
1772}
1773
1774#ifndef XENPV
1775/*
1776 * pmap_cpu_init_late: perform late per-CPU initialization.
1777 */
1778void
1779pmap_cpu_init_late(struct cpu_info *ci)
1780{
1781 /*
1782 * The BP has already its own PD page allocated during early
1783 * MD startup.
1784 */
1785 if (ci == &cpu_info_primary)
1786 return;
1787#ifdef PAE
1788 cpu_alloc_l3_page(ci);
1789#endif
1790}
1791#endif
1792
1793#ifndef __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP
1794CTASSERT(CACHE_LINE_SIZE > sizeof(pt_entry_t));
1795CTASSERT(CACHE_LINE_SIZE % sizeof(pt_entry_t) == 0);
1796
1797static void
1798pmap_vpage_cpualloc(struct cpu_info *ci)
1799{
1800 bool primary = (ci == &cpu_info_primary);
1801 size_t i, npages;
1802 vaddr_t vabase;
1803 vsize_t vrange;
1804
1805 npages = (CACHE_LINE_SIZE / sizeof(pt_entry_t));
1806 KASSERT(npages >= VPAGE_MAX);
1807 vrange = npages * PAGE_SIZE;
1808
1809 if (primary) {
1810 while ((vabase = pmap_bootstrap_valloc(1)) % vrange != 0) {
1811 /* Waste some pages to align properly */
1812 }
1813 /* The base is aligned, allocate the rest (contiguous) */
1814 pmap_bootstrap_valloc(npages - 1);
1815 } else {
1816 vabase = uvm_km_alloc(kernel_map, vrange, vrange,
1817 UVM_KMF_VAONLY);
1818 if (vabase == 0) {
1819 panic("%s: failed to allocate tmp VA for CPU %d\n",
1820 __func__, cpu_index(ci));
1821 }
1822 }
1823
1824 KASSERT((vaddr_t)&PTE_BASE[pl1_i(vabase)] % CACHE_LINE_SIZE == 0);
1825
1826 for (i = 0; i < VPAGE_MAX; i++) {
1827 ci->vpage[i] = vabase + i * PAGE_SIZE;
1828 ci->vpage_pte[i] = PTE_BASE + pl1_i(ci->vpage[i]);
1829 }
1830}
1831
1832void
1833pmap_vpage_cpu_init(struct cpu_info *ci)
1834{
1835 if (ci == &cpu_info_primary) {
1836 /* cpu0 already taken care of in pmap_bootstrap */
1837 return;
1838 }
1839
1840 pmap_vpage_cpualloc(ci);
1841}
1842#endif
1843
1844/*
1845 * p v _ e n t r y f u n c t i o n s
1846 */
1847
1848static bool
1849pmap_pp_needs_pve(struct pmap_page *pp)
1850{
1851
1852 /*
1853 * Adding a pv entry for this page only needs to allocate a pv_entry
1854 * structure if the page already has at least one pv entry,
1855 * since the first pv entry is stored in the pmap_page.
1856 */
1857
1858 return pp && ((pp->pp_flags & PP_EMBEDDED) != 0 ||
1859 !LIST_EMPTY(&pp->pp_head.pvh_list));
1860}
1861
1862static void
1863pmap_free_pvs(struct pv_entry *pve)
1864{
1865 struct pv_entry *next;
1866
1867 for ( /* null */ ; pve != NULL ; pve = next) {
1868 next = pve->pve_next;
1869 pool_cache_put(&pmap_pv_cache, pve);
1870 }
1871}
1872
1873/*
1874 * main pv_entry manipulation functions:
1875 * pmap_enter_pv: enter a mapping onto a pv_head list
1876 * pmap_remove_pv: remove a mapping from a pv_head list
1877 *
1878 * NOTE: Both pmap_enter_pv and pmap_remove_pv expect the caller to lock
1879 * the pvh before calling
1880 */
1881
1882/*
1883 * insert_pv: a helper of pmap_enter_pv
1884 */
1885static void
1886insert_pv(struct pmap_page *pp, struct pv_entry *pve)
1887{
1888 struct pv_hash_head *hh;
1889 kmutex_t *lock;
1890 u_int hash;
1891
1892 hash = pvhash_hash(pve->pve_pte.pte_ptp, pve->pve_pte.pte_va);
1893 lock = pvhash_lock(hash);
1894 hh = pvhash_head(hash);
1895 mutex_spin_enter(lock);
1896 SLIST_INSERT_HEAD(&hh->hh_list, pve, pve_hash);
1897 mutex_spin_exit(lock);
1898
1899 LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&pp->pp_head.pvh_list, pve, pve_list);
1900}
1901
1902/*
1903 * pmap_enter_pv: enter a mapping onto a pv_head lst
1904 *
1905 * => caller should adjust ptp's wire_count before calling
1906 * => caller has preallocated pve and *sparepve for us
1907 */
1908static struct pv_entry *
1909pmap_enter_pv(struct pmap_page *pp, struct pv_entry *pve,
1910 struct pv_entry **sparepve, struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t va)
1911{
1912
1913 KASSERT(ptp == NULL || ptp->wire_count >= 2);
1914 KASSERT(ptp == NULL || ptp->uobject != NULL);
1915 KASSERT(ptp == NULL || ptp_va2o(va, 1) == ptp->offset);
1916
1917 if ((pp->pp_flags & PP_EMBEDDED) == 0) {
1918 if (LIST_EMPTY(&pp->pp_head.pvh_list)) {
1919 pp->pp_flags |= PP_EMBEDDED;
1920 pp->pp_pte.pte_ptp = ptp;
1921 pp->pp_pte.pte_va = va;
1922
1923 return pve;
1924 }
1925 } else {
1926 struct pv_entry *pve2;
1927
1928 pve2 = *sparepve;
1929 *sparepve = NULL;
1930
1931 pve2->pve_pte = pp->pp_pte;
1932 pp->pp_flags &= ~PP_EMBEDDED;
1933 LIST_INIT(&pp->pp_head.pvh_list);
1934 insert_pv(pp, pve2);
1935 }
1936
1937 pve->pve_pte.pte_ptp = ptp;
1938 pve->pve_pte.pte_va = va;
1939 insert_pv(pp, pve);
1940
1941 return NULL;
1942}
1943
1944/*
1945 * pmap_remove_pv: try to remove a mapping from a pv_list
1946 *
1947 * => caller should adjust ptp's wire_count and free PTP if needed
1948 * => we return the removed pve
1949 */
1950static struct pv_entry *
1951pmap_remove_pv(struct pmap_page *pp, struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t va)
1952{
1953 struct pv_hash_head *hh;
1954 struct pv_entry *pve;
1955 kmutex_t *lock;
1956 u_int hash;
1957
1958 KASSERT(ptp == NULL || ptp->uobject != NULL);
1959 KASSERT(ptp == NULL || ptp_va2o(va, 1) == ptp->offset);
1960
1961 if ((pp->pp_flags & PP_EMBEDDED) != 0) {
1962 KASSERT(pp->pp_pte.pte_ptp == ptp);
1963 KASSERT(pp->pp_pte.pte_va == va);
1964
1965 pp->pp_flags &= ~PP_EMBEDDED;
1966 LIST_INIT(&pp->pp_head.pvh_list);
1967
1968 return NULL;
1969 }
1970
1971 hash = pvhash_hash(ptp, va);
1972 lock = pvhash_lock(hash);
1973 hh = pvhash_head(hash);
1974 mutex_spin_enter(lock);
1975 pve = pvhash_remove(hh, ptp, va);
1976 mutex_spin_exit(lock);
1977
1978 LIST_REMOVE(pve, pve_list);
1979
1980 return pve;
1981}
1982
1983/*
1984 * p t p f u n c t i o n s
1985 */
1986
1987static inline struct vm_page *
1988pmap_find_ptp(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va, paddr_t pa, int level)
1989{
1990 int lidx = level - 1;
1991 struct vm_page *pg;
1992
1993 KASSERT(mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
1994
1995 if (pa != (paddr_t)-1 && pmap->pm_ptphint[lidx] &&
1996 pa == VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(pmap->pm_ptphint[lidx])) {
1997 return (pmap->pm_ptphint[lidx]);
1998 }
1999 PMAP_SUBOBJ_LOCK(pmap, lidx);
2000 pg = uvm_pagelookup(&pmap->pm_obj[lidx], ptp_va2o(va, level));
2001 PMAP_SUBOBJ_UNLOCK(pmap, lidx);
2002
2003 KASSERT(pg == NULL || pg->wire_count >= 1);
2004 return pg;
2005}
2006
2007static inline void
2008pmap_freepage(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, int level)
2009{
2010 lwp_t *l;
2011 int lidx;
2012 struct uvm_object *obj;
2013
2014 KASSERT(ptp->wire_count == 1);
2015
2016 lidx = level - 1;
2017
2018 obj = &pmap->pm_obj[lidx];
2019 pmap_stats_update(pmap, -1, 0);
2020 if (lidx != 0)
2021 mutex_enter(obj->vmobjlock);
2022 if (pmap->pm_ptphint[lidx] == ptp)
2023 pmap->pm_ptphint[lidx] = TAILQ_FIRST(&obj->memq);
2024 ptp->wire_count = 0;
2025 uvm_pagerealloc(ptp, NULL, 0);
2026 l = curlwp;
2027 KASSERT((l->l_pflag & LP_INTR) == 0);
2028 VM_PAGE_TO_PP(ptp)->pp_link = l->l_md.md_gc_ptp;
2029 l->l_md.md_gc_ptp = ptp;
2030 if (lidx != 0)
2031 mutex_exit(obj->vmobjlock);
2032}
2033
2034static void
2035pmap_free_ptp(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t va,
2036 pt_entry_t *ptes, pd_entry_t * const *pdes)
2037{
2038 unsigned long index;
2039 int level;
2040 vaddr_t invaladdr;
2041 pd_entry_t opde;
2042
2043 KASSERT(pmap != pmap_kernel());
2044 KASSERT(mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
2045 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
2046
2047 level = 1;
2048 do {
2049 index = pl_i(va, level + 1);
2050 opde = pmap_pte_testset(&pdes[level - 1][index], 0);
2051
2052 /*
2053 * On Xen-amd64 or SVS, we need to sync the top level page
2054 * directory on each CPU.
2055 */
2056#if defined(XENPV) && defined(__x86_64__)
2057 if (level == PTP_LEVELS - 1) {
2058 xen_kpm_sync(pmap, index);
2059 }
2060#elif defined(SVS)
2061 if (svs_enabled && level == PTP_LEVELS - 1) {
2062 svs_pmap_sync(pmap, index);
2063 }
2064#endif
2065
2066 invaladdr = level == 1 ? (vaddr_t)ptes :
2067 (vaddr_t)pdes[level - 2];
2068 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, invaladdr + index * PAGE_SIZE,
2069 opde, TLBSHOOT_FREE_PTP1);
2070
2071#if defined(XENPV)
2072 pmap_tlb_shootnow();
2073#endif
2074
2075 pmap_freepage(pmap, ptp, level);
2076 if (level < PTP_LEVELS - 1) {
2077 ptp = pmap_find_ptp(pmap, va, (paddr_t)-1, level + 1);
2078 ptp->wire_count--;
2079 if (ptp->wire_count > 1)
2080 break;
2081 }
2082 } while (++level < PTP_LEVELS);
2083 pmap_pte_flush();
2084}
2085
2086/*
2087 * pmap_get_ptp: get a PTP (if there isn't one, allocate a new one)
2088 *
2089 * => pmap should NOT be pmap_kernel()
2090 * => pmap should be locked
2091 * => preemption should be disabled
2092 */
2093static struct vm_page *
2094pmap_get_ptp(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va, pd_entry_t * const *pdes, int flags)
2095{
2096 struct vm_page *ptp;
2097 struct {
2098 struct vm_page *pg;
2099 bool new;
2100 } pt[PTP_LEVELS + 1];
2101 int i, aflags;
2102 unsigned long index;
2103 pd_entry_t *pva;
2104 paddr_t pa;
2105 struct uvm_object *obj;
2106 voff_t off;
2107
2108 KASSERT(pmap != pmap_kernel());
2109 KASSERT(mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
2110 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
2111
2112 /*
2113 * Loop through all page table levels allocating a page
2114 * for any level where we don't already have one.
2115 */
2116 memset(pt, 0, sizeof(pt));
2117 aflags = ((flags & PMAP_CANFAIL) ? 0 : UVM_PGA_USERESERVE) |
2118 UVM_PGA_ZERO;
2119 for (i = PTP_LEVELS; i > 1; i--) {
2120 obj = &pmap->pm_obj[i - 2];
2121 off = ptp_va2o(va, i - 1);
2122
2123 PMAP_SUBOBJ_LOCK(pmap, i - 2);
2124 pt[i].pg = uvm_pagelookup(obj, off);
2125 if (pt[i].pg == NULL) {
2126 pt[i].pg = uvm_pagealloc(obj, off, NULL, aflags);
2127 pt[i].new = true;
2128 }
2129 PMAP_SUBOBJ_UNLOCK(pmap, i - 2);
2130
2131 if (pt[i].pg == NULL)
2132 goto fail;
2133 }
2134
2135 /*
2136 * Now that we have all the pages looked up or allocated,
2137 * loop through again installing any new ones into the tree.
2138 */
2139 for (i = PTP_LEVELS; i > 1; i--) {
2140 index = pl_i(va, i);
2141 pva = pdes[i - 2];
2142
2143 if (pmap_valid_entry(pva[index])) {
2144 KASSERT(!pt[i].new);
2145 continue;
2146 }
2147
2148 ptp = pt[i].pg;
2149 ptp->flags &= ~PG_BUSY; /* never busy */
2150 ptp->wire_count = 1;
2151 pmap->pm_ptphint[i - 2] = ptp;
2152 pa = VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(ptp);
2153 pmap_pte_set(&pva[index], (pd_entry_t)
2154 (pmap_pa2pte(pa) | PTE_U | PTE_W | PTE_P));
2155
2156 /*
2157 * On Xen-amd64 or SVS, we need to sync the top level page
2158 * directory on each CPU.
2159 */
2160#if defined(XENPV) && defined(__x86_64__)
2161 if (i == PTP_LEVELS) {
2162 xen_kpm_sync(pmap, index);
2163 }
2164#elif defined(SVS)
2165 if (svs_enabled && i == PTP_LEVELS) {
2166 svs_pmap_sync(pmap, index);
2167 }
2168#endif
2169
2170 pmap_pte_flush();
2171 pmap_stats_update(pmap, 1, 0);
2172
2173 /*
2174 * If we're not in the top level, increase the
2175 * wire count of the parent page.
2176 */
2177 if (i < PTP_LEVELS) {
2178 pt[i + 1].pg->wire_count++;
2179 }
2180 }
2181 ptp = pt[2].pg;
2182 KASSERT(ptp != NULL);
2183 pmap->pm_ptphint[0] = ptp;
2184 return ptp;
2185
2186 /*
2187 * Allocation of a PTP failed, free any others that we just allocated.
2188 */
2189fail:
2190 for (i = PTP_LEVELS; i > 1; i--) {
2191 if (pt[i].pg == NULL) {
2192 break;
2193 }
2194 if (!pt[i].new) {
2195 continue;
2196 }
2197 obj = &pmap->pm_obj[i - 2];
2198 PMAP_SUBOBJ_LOCK(pmap, i - 2);
2199 uvm_pagefree(pt[i].pg);
2200 PMAP_SUBOBJ_UNLOCK(pmap, i - 2);
2201 }
2202 return NULL;
2203}
2204
2205/*
2206 * p m a p l i f e c y c l e f u n c t i o n s
2207 */
2208
2209/*
2210 * pmap_pdp_ctor: constructor for the PDP cache.
2211 */
2212static int
2213pmap_pdp_ctor(void *arg, void *v, int flags)
2214{
2215 pd_entry_t *pdir = v;
2216 paddr_t pdirpa = 0;
2217 vaddr_t object;
2218 int i;
2219
2220#if !defined(XENPV) || !defined(__x86_64__)
2221 int npde;
2222#endif
2223#ifdef XENPV
2224 int s;
2225#endif
2226
2227 memset(pdir, 0, PDP_SIZE * PAGE_SIZE);
2228
2229 /*
2230 * NOTE: The `pmaps_lock' is held when the PDP is allocated.
2231 */
2232
2233#if defined(XENPV) && defined(__x86_64__)
2234 /* Fetch the physical address of the page directory */
2235 (void)pmap_extract(pmap_kernel(), (vaddr_t)pdir, &pdirpa);
2236
2237 /*
2238 * This pdir will NEVER be active in kernel mode, so mark
2239 * recursive entry invalid.
2240 */
2241 pdir[PDIR_SLOT_PTE] = pmap_pa2pte(pdirpa);
2242
2243 /*
2244 * PDP constructed this way won't be for the kernel, hence we
2245 * don't put kernel mappings on Xen.
2246 *
2247 * But we need to make pmap_create() happy, so put a dummy
2248 * (without PTE_P) value at the right place.
2249 */
2250 pdir[PDIR_SLOT_KERN + nkptp[PTP_LEVELS - 1] - 1] =
2251 (pd_entry_t)-1 & PTE_FRAME;
2252#else /* XENPV && __x86_64__*/
2253 object = (vaddr_t)v;
2254 for (i = 0; i < PDP_SIZE; i++, object += PAGE_SIZE) {
2255 /* Fetch the physical address of the page directory */
2256 (void)pmap_extract(pmap_kernel(), object, &pdirpa);
2257
2258 /* Put in recursive PDE to map the PTEs */
2259 pdir[PDIR_SLOT_PTE + i] = pmap_pa2pte(pdirpa) | PTE_P |
2260 pmap_pg_nx;
2261#ifndef XENPV
2262 pdir[PDIR_SLOT_PTE + i] |= PTE_W;
2263#endif
2264 }
2265
2266 /* Copy the kernel's top level PDE */
2267 npde = nkptp[PTP_LEVELS - 1];
2268
2269 memcpy(&pdir[PDIR_SLOT_KERN], &PDP_BASE[PDIR_SLOT_KERN],
2270 npde * sizeof(pd_entry_t));
2271
2272 if (VM_MIN_KERNEL_ADDRESS != KERNBASE) {
2273 int idx = pl_i(KERNBASE, PTP_LEVELS);
2274 pdir[idx] = PDP_BASE[idx];
2275 }
2276
2277#ifdef __HAVE_PCPU_AREA
2278 pdir[PDIR_SLOT_PCPU] = PDP_BASE[PDIR_SLOT_PCPU];
2279#endif
2280#ifdef __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP
2281 slotspace_copy(SLAREA_DMAP, pdir, PDP_BASE);
2282#endif
2283#ifdef KASAN
2284 slotspace_copy(SLAREA_ASAN, pdir, PDP_BASE);
2285#endif
2286#endif /* XENPV && __x86_64__*/
2287
2288#ifdef XENPV
2289 s = splvm();
2290 object = (vaddr_t)v;
2291 pmap_protect(pmap_kernel(), object, object + (PAGE_SIZE * PDP_SIZE),
2292 VM_PROT_READ);
2293 pmap_update(pmap_kernel());
2294 for (i = 0; i < PDP_SIZE; i++, object += PAGE_SIZE) {
2295 /*
2296 * pin as L2/L4 page, we have to do the page with the
2297 * PDIR_SLOT_PTE entries last
2298 */
2299#ifdef PAE
2300 if (i == l2tol3(PDIR_SLOT_PTE))
2301 continue;
2302#endif
2303
2304 (void) pmap_extract(pmap_kernel(), object, &pdirpa);
2305#ifdef __x86_64__
2306 xpq_queue_pin_l4_table(xpmap_ptom_masked(pdirpa));
2307#else
2308 xpq_queue_pin_l2_table(xpmap_ptom_masked(pdirpa));
2309#endif
2310 }
2311#ifdef PAE
2312 object = ((vaddr_t)pdir) + PAGE_SIZE * l2tol3(PDIR_SLOT_PTE);
2313 (void)pmap_extract(pmap_kernel(), object, &pdirpa);
2314 xpq_queue_pin_l2_table(xpmap_ptom_masked(pdirpa));
2315#endif
2316 splx(s);
2317#endif /* XENPV */
2318
2319 return 0;
2320}
2321
2322/*
2323 * pmap_pdp_dtor: destructor for the PDP cache.
2324 */
2325static void
2326pmap_pdp_dtor(void *arg, void *v)
2327{
2328#ifdef XENPV
2329 paddr_t pdirpa = 0; /* XXX: GCC */
2330 vaddr_t object = (vaddr_t)v;
2331 int i;
2332 int s = splvm();
2333 pt_entry_t *pte;
2334
2335 for (i = 0; i < PDP_SIZE; i++, object += PAGE_SIZE) {
2336 /* fetch the physical address of the page directory. */
2337 (void) pmap_extract(pmap_kernel(), object, &pdirpa);
2338 /* unpin page table */
2339 xpq_queue_unpin_table(xpmap_ptom_masked(pdirpa));
2340 }
2341 object = (vaddr_t)v;
2342 for (i = 0; i < PDP_SIZE; i++, object += PAGE_SIZE) {
2343 /* Set page RW again */
2344 pte = kvtopte(object);
2345 pmap_pte_set(pte, *pte | PTE_W);
2346 xen_bcast_invlpg((vaddr_t)object);
2347 }
2348 splx(s);
2349#endif /* XENPV */
2350}
2351
2352#ifdef PAE
2353static void *
2354pmap_pdp_alloc(struct pool *pp, int flags)
2355{
2356 return (void *)uvm_km_alloc(kernel_map,
2357 PAGE_SIZE * PDP_SIZE, PAGE_SIZE * PDP_SIZE,
2358 ((flags & PR_WAITOK) ? 0 : UVM_KMF_NOWAIT | UVM_KMF_TRYLOCK) |
2359 UVM_KMF_WIRED);
2360}
2361
2362static void
2363pmap_pdp_free(struct pool *pp, void *v)
2364{
2365 uvm_km_free(kernel_map, (vaddr_t)v, PAGE_SIZE * PDP_SIZE,
2366 UVM_KMF_WIRED);
2367}
2368#endif /* PAE */
2369
2370/*
2371 * pmap_create: create a pmap object.
2372 */
2373struct pmap *
2374pmap_create(void)
2375{
2376 struct pmap *pmap;
2377 int i;
2378
2379 pmap = pool_cache_get(&pmap_cache, PR_WAITOK);
2380
2381 /* init uvm_object */
2382 for (i = 0; i < PTP_LEVELS - 1; i++) {
2383 mutex_init(&pmap->pm_obj_lock[i], MUTEX_DEFAULT, IPL_NONE);
2384 uvm_obj_init(&pmap->pm_obj[i], NULL, false, 1);
2385 uvm_obj_setlock(&pmap->pm_obj[i], &pmap->pm_obj_lock[i]);
2386 pmap->pm_ptphint[i] = NULL;
2387 }
2388 pmap->pm_stats.wired_count = 0;
2389 /* count the PDP allocd below */
2390 pmap->pm_stats.resident_count = PDP_SIZE;
2391#if !defined(__x86_64__)
2392 pmap->pm_hiexec = 0;
2393#endif
2394 pmap->pm_flags = 0;
2395 pmap->pm_gc_ptp = NULL;
2396
2397 /* Used by NVMM. */
2398 pmap->pm_enter = NULL;
2399 pmap->pm_extract = NULL;
2400 pmap->pm_remove = NULL;
2401 pmap->pm_sync_pv = NULL;
2402 pmap->pm_pp_remove_ent = NULL;
2403 pmap->pm_write_protect = NULL;
2404 pmap->pm_unwire = NULL;
2405 pmap->pm_tlb_flush = NULL;
2406 pmap->pm_data = NULL;
2407
2408 kcpuset_create(&pmap->pm_cpus, true);
2409 kcpuset_create(&pmap->pm_kernel_cpus, true);
2410#ifdef XENPV
2411 kcpuset_create(&pmap->pm_xen_ptp_cpus, true);
2412#endif
2413 /* init the LDT */
2414 pmap->pm_ldt = NULL;
2415 pmap->pm_ldt_len = 0;
2416 pmap->pm_ldt_sel = GSYSSEL(GLDT_SEL, SEL_KPL);
2417
2418 /* allocate PDP */
2419 try_again:
2420 pmap->pm_pdir = pool_cache_get(&pmap_pdp_cache, PR_WAITOK);
2421
2422 mutex_enter(&pmaps_lock);
2423
2424 if (pmap->pm_pdir[PDIR_SLOT_KERN + nkptp[PTP_LEVELS - 1] - 1] == 0) {
2425 mutex_exit(&pmaps_lock);
2426 pool_cache_destruct_object(&pmap_pdp_cache, pmap->pm_pdir);
2427 goto try_again;
2428 }
2429
2430 for (i = 0; i < PDP_SIZE; i++)
2431 pmap->pm_pdirpa[i] =
2432 pmap_pte2pa(pmap->pm_pdir[PDIR_SLOT_PTE + i]);
2433
2434 LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&pmaps, pmap, pm_list);
2435
2436 mutex_exit(&pmaps_lock);
2437
2438 return (pmap);
2439}
2440
2441/*
2442 * pmap_free_ptps: put a list of ptps back to the freelist.
2443 */
2444void
2445pmap_free_ptps(struct vm_page *empty_ptps)
2446{
2447 struct vm_page *ptp;
2448 struct pmap_page *pp;
2449
2450 while ((ptp = empty_ptps) != NULL) {
2451 pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(ptp);
2452 empty_ptps = pp->pp_link;
2453 LIST_INIT(&pp->pp_head.pvh_list);
2454 uvm_pagefree(ptp);
2455 }
2456}
2457
2458/*
2459 * pmap_check_ptps: verify that none of the pmap's page table objects
2460 * have any pages allocated to them.
2461 */
2462static inline void
2463pmap_check_ptps(struct pmap *pmap)
2464{
2465 int i;
2466
2467 for (i = 0; i < PTP_LEVELS - 1; i++) {
2468 KASSERT(pmap->pm_obj[i].uo_npages == 0);
2469 KASSERT(TAILQ_EMPTY(&pmap->pm_obj[i].memq));
2470 }
2471}
2472
2473static inline void
2474pmap_check_inuse(struct pmap *pmap)
2475{
2476#ifdef DIAGNOSTIC
2477 CPU_INFO_ITERATOR cii;
2478 struct cpu_info *ci;
2479
2480 for (CPU_INFO_FOREACH(cii, ci)) {
2481 if (ci->ci_pmap == pmap)
2482 panic("destroying pmap being used");
2483#if defined(XENPV) && defined(__x86_64__)
2484 for (int i = 0; i < PDIR_SLOT_USERLIM; i++) {
2485 if (pmap->pm_pdir[i] != 0 &&
2486 ci->ci_kpm_pdir[i] == pmap->pm_pdir[i]) {
2487 printf("pmap_destroy(%p) pmap_kernel %p "
2488 "curcpu %d cpu %d ci_pmap %p "
2489 "ci->ci_kpm_pdir[%d]=%" PRIx64
2490 " pmap->pm_pdir[%d]=%" PRIx64 "\n",
2491 pmap, pmap_kernel(), curcpu()->ci_index,
2492 ci->ci_index, ci->ci_pmap,
2493 i, ci->ci_kpm_pdir[i],
2494 i, pmap->pm_pdir[i]);
2495 panic("%s: used pmap", __func__);
2496 }
2497 }
2498#endif
2499 }
2500#endif /* DIAGNOSTIC */
2501}
2502
2503/*
2504 * pmap_destroy: drop reference count on pmap. free pmap if
2505 * reference count goes to zero.
2506 */
2507void
2508pmap_destroy(struct pmap *pmap)
2509{
2510 lwp_t *l;
2511 int i;
2512
2513 /*
2514 * If we have torn down this pmap, process deferred frees and
2515 * invalidations. Free now if the system is low on memory.
2516 * Otherwise, free when the pmap is destroyed thus avoiding a
2517 * TLB shootdown.
2518 */
2519 l = curlwp;
2520 if (__predict_false(l->l_md.md_gc_pmap == pmap)) {
2521 pmap_check_ptps(pmap);
2522 if (uvmexp.free < uvmexp.freetarg) {
2523 pmap_update(pmap);
2524 } else {
2525 KASSERT(pmap->pm_gc_ptp == NULL);
2526 pmap->pm_gc_ptp = l->l_md.md_gc_ptp;
2527 l->l_md.md_gc_ptp = NULL;
2528 l->l_md.md_gc_pmap = NULL;
2529 }
2530 }
2531
2532 /*
2533 * drop reference count
2534 */
2535
2536 if (atomic_dec_uint_nv(&pmap->pm_obj[0].uo_refs) > 0) {
2537 return;
2538 }
2539
2540 pmap_check_inuse(pmap);
2541
2542 /*
2543 * Reference count is zero, free pmap resources and then free pmap.
2544 * First, remove it from global list of pmaps.
2545 */
2546
2547 mutex_enter(&pmaps_lock);
2548 LIST_REMOVE(pmap, pm_list);
2549 mutex_exit(&pmaps_lock);
2550
2551 /*
2552 * Process deferred PTP frees. No TLB shootdown required, as the
2553 * PTP pages are no longer visible to any CPU.
2554 */
2555
2556 pmap_free_ptps(pmap->pm_gc_ptp);
2557
2558 if (__predict_false(pmap->pm_enter != NULL)) {
2559 pool_cache_destruct_object(&pmap_pdp_cache, pmap->pm_pdir);
2560 } else {
2561 pool_cache_put(&pmap_pdp_cache, pmap->pm_pdir);
2562 }
2563
2564#ifdef USER_LDT
2565 if (pmap->pm_ldt != NULL) {
2566 /*
2567 * no need to switch the LDT; this address space is gone,
2568 * nothing is using it.
2569 *
2570 * No need to lock the pmap for ldt_free (or anything else),
2571 * we're the last one to use it.
2572 */
2573 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
2574 ldt_free(pmap->pm_ldt_sel);
2575 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
2576 uvm_km_free(kernel_map, (vaddr_t)pmap->pm_ldt,
2577 pmap->pm_ldt_len, UVM_KMF_WIRED);
2578 }
2579#endif
2580
2581 for (i = 0; i < PTP_LEVELS - 1; i++) {
2582 uvm_obj_destroy(&pmap->pm_obj[i], false);
2583 mutex_destroy(&pmap->pm_obj_lock[i]);
2584 }
2585 kcpuset_destroy(pmap->pm_cpus);
2586 kcpuset_destroy(pmap->pm_kernel_cpus);
2587#ifdef XENPV
2588 kcpuset_destroy(pmap->pm_xen_ptp_cpus);
2589#endif
2590
2591 pmap_check_ptps(pmap);
2592 pool_cache_put(&pmap_cache, pmap);
2593}
2594
2595/*
2596 * pmap_remove_all: pmap is being torn down by the current thread.
2597 * avoid unnecessary invalidations.
2598 */
2599void
2600pmap_remove_all(struct pmap *pmap)
2601{
2602 lwp_t *l = curlwp;
2603
2604 KASSERT(l->l_md.md_gc_pmap == NULL);
2605
2606 l->l_md.md_gc_pmap = pmap;
2607}
2608
2609#if defined(PMAP_FORK)
2610/*
2611 * pmap_fork: perform any necessary data structure manipulation when
2612 * a VM space is forked.
2613 */
2614void
2615pmap_fork(struct pmap *pmap1, struct pmap *pmap2)
2616{
2617#ifdef USER_LDT
2618 union descriptor *new_ldt;
2619 size_t len;
2620 int sel;
2621
2622 if (__predict_true(pmap1->pm_ldt == NULL)) {
2623 return;
2624 }
2625
2626 /*
2627 * Copy the LDT into the new process.
2628 *
2629 * Read pmap1's ldt pointer and length unlocked; if it changes
2630 * behind our back we'll retry. This will starve if there's a
2631 * stream of LDT changes in another thread but that should not
2632 * happen.
2633 */
2634
2635 retry:
2636 if (pmap1->pm_ldt != NULL) {
2637 len = pmap1->pm_ldt_len;
2638 /* Allocate space for the new process's LDT */
2639 new_ldt = (union descriptor *)uvm_km_alloc(kernel_map, len, 0,
2640 UVM_KMF_WIRED);
2641 if (new_ldt == NULL) {
2642 printf("WARNING: %s: unable to allocate LDT space\n",
2643 __func__);
2644 return;
2645 }
2646 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
2647 /* Get a GDT slot for it */
2648 sel = ldt_alloc(new_ldt, len);
2649 if (sel == -1) {
2650 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
2651 uvm_km_free(kernel_map, (vaddr_t)new_ldt, len,
2652 UVM_KMF_WIRED);
2653 printf("WARNING: %s: unable to allocate LDT selector\n",
2654 __func__);
2655 return;
2656 }
2657 } else {
2658 /* Wasn't anything there after all. */
2659 len = -1;
2660 new_ldt = NULL;
2661 sel = -1;
2662 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
2663 }
2664
2665 /* If there's still something there now that we have cpu_lock... */
2666 if (pmap1->pm_ldt != NULL) {
2667 if (len != pmap1->pm_ldt_len) {
2668 /* Oops, it changed. Drop what we did and try again */
2669 if (len != -1) {
2670 ldt_free(sel);
2671 uvm_km_free(kernel_map, (vaddr_t)new_ldt,
2672 len, UVM_KMF_WIRED);
2673 }
2674 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
2675 goto retry;
2676 }
2677
2678 /* Copy the LDT data and install it in pmap2 */
2679 memcpy(new_ldt, pmap1->pm_ldt, len);
2680 pmap2->pm_ldt = new_ldt;
2681 pmap2->pm_ldt_len = pmap1->pm_ldt_len;
2682 pmap2->pm_ldt_sel = sel;
2683 len = -1;
2684 }
2685
2686 if (len != -1) {
2687 /* There wasn't still something there, so mop up */
2688 ldt_free(sel);
2689 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
2690 uvm_km_free(kernel_map, (vaddr_t)new_ldt, len,
2691 UVM_KMF_WIRED);
2692 } else {
2693 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
2694 }
2695#endif /* USER_LDT */
2696}
2697#endif /* PMAP_FORK */
2698
2699#ifdef USER_LDT
2700
2701/*
2702 * pmap_ldt_xcall: cross call used by pmap_ldt_sync. if the named pmap
2703 * is active, reload LDTR.
2704 */
2705static void
2706pmap_ldt_xcall(void *arg1, void *arg2)
2707{
2708 struct pmap *pm;
2709
2710 kpreempt_disable();
2711 pm = arg1;
2712 if (curcpu()->ci_pmap == pm) {
2713 lldt(pm->pm_ldt_sel);
2714 }
2715 kpreempt_enable();
2716}
2717
2718/*
2719 * pmap_ldt_sync: LDT selector for the named pmap is changing. swap
2720 * in the new selector on all CPUs.
2721 */
2722void
2723pmap_ldt_sync(struct pmap *pm)
2724{
2725 uint64_t where;
2726
2727 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&cpu_lock));
2728
2729 pmap_ldt_evcnt.ev_count++;
2730 where = xc_broadcast(0, pmap_ldt_xcall, pm, NULL);
2731 xc_wait(where);
2732}
2733
2734/*
2735 * pmap_ldt_cleanup: if the pmap has a local LDT, deallocate it, and
2736 * restore the default.
2737 */
2738void
2739pmap_ldt_cleanup(struct lwp *l)
2740{
2741 pmap_t pmap = l->l_proc->p_vmspace->vm_map.pmap;
2742 union descriptor *dp = NULL;
2743 size_t len = 0;
2744 int sel = -1;
2745
2746 if (__predict_true(pmap->pm_ldt == NULL)) {
2747 return;
2748 }
2749
2750 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
2751 if (pmap->pm_ldt != NULL) {
2752 sel = pmap->pm_ldt_sel;
2753 dp = pmap->pm_ldt;
2754 len = pmap->pm_ldt_len;
2755 pmap->pm_ldt_sel = GSYSSEL(GLDT_SEL, SEL_KPL);
2756 pmap->pm_ldt = NULL;
2757 pmap->pm_ldt_len = 0;
2758 pmap_ldt_sync(pmap);
2759 ldt_free(sel);
2760 uvm_km_free(kernel_map, (vaddr_t)dp, len, UVM_KMF_WIRED);
2761 }
2762 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
2763}
2764#endif /* USER_LDT */
2765
2766/*
2767 * pmap_activate: activate a process' pmap
2768 *
2769 * => must be called with kernel preemption disabled
2770 * => if lwp is the curlwp, then set ci_want_pmapload so that
2771 * actual MMU context switch will be done by pmap_load() later
2772 */
2773void
2774pmap_activate(struct lwp *l)
2775{
2776 struct cpu_info *ci;
2777 struct pmap *pmap = vm_map_pmap(&l->l_proc->p_vmspace->vm_map);
2778
2779 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
2780
2781 ci = curcpu();
2782
2783 if (l != ci->ci_curlwp)
2784 return;
2785
2786 KASSERT(ci->ci_want_pmapload == 0);
2787 KASSERT(ci->ci_tlbstate != TLBSTATE_VALID);
2788
2789 /*
2790 * no need to switch to kernel vmspace because
2791 * it's a subset of any vmspace.
2792 */
2793
2794 if (pmap == pmap_kernel()) {
2795 ci->ci_want_pmapload = 0;
2796 return;
2797 }
2798
2799 ci->ci_want_pmapload = 1;
2800}
2801
2802#if defined(XENPV) && defined(__x86_64__)
2803#define KASSERT_PDIRPA(pmap) \
2804 KASSERT(pmap_pdirpa(pmap, 0) == ci->ci_xen_current_user_pgd || \
2805 pmap == pmap_kernel())
2806#elif defined(PAE)
2807#define KASSERT_PDIRPA(pmap) \
2808 KASSERT(pmap_pdirpa(pmap, 0) == pmap_pte2pa(ci->ci_pae_l3_pdir[0]))
2809#elif !defined(XENPV)
2810#define KASSERT_PDIRPA(pmap) \
2811 KASSERT(pmap_pdirpa(pmap, 0) == pmap_pte2pa(rcr3()))
2812#else
2813#define KASSERT_PDIRPA(pmap) KASSERT(true) /* nothing to do */
2814#endif
2815
2816/*
2817 * pmap_reactivate: try to regain reference to the pmap.
2818 *
2819 * => Must be called with kernel preemption disabled.
2820 */
2821static void
2822pmap_reactivate(struct pmap *pmap)
2823{
2824 struct cpu_info * const ci = curcpu();
2825 const cpuid_t cid = cpu_index(ci);
2826
2827 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
2828 KASSERT_PDIRPA(pmap);
2829
2830 /*
2831 * If we still have a lazy reference to this pmap, we can assume
2832 * that there was no TLB shootdown for this pmap in the meantime.
2833 *
2834 * The order of events here is important as we must synchronize
2835 * with TLB shootdown interrupts. Declare interest in invalidations
2836 * (TLBSTATE_VALID) and then check the CPU set, which the IPIs can
2837 * change only when the state is TLBSTATE_LAZY.
2838 */
2839
2840 ci->ci_tlbstate = TLBSTATE_VALID;
2841 KASSERT(kcpuset_isset(pmap->pm_kernel_cpus, cid));
2842
2843 if (kcpuset_isset(pmap->pm_cpus, cid)) {
2844 /* We have the reference, state is valid. */
2845 } else {
2846 /*
2847 * Must reload the TLB, pmap has been changed during
2848 * deactivated.
2849 */
2850 kcpuset_atomic_set(pmap->pm_cpus, cid);
2851
2852 tlbflush();
2853 }
2854}
2855
2856/*
2857 * pmap_load: perform the actual pmap switch, i.e. fill in %cr3 register
2858 * and relevant LDT info.
2859 *
2860 * Ensures that the current process' pmap is loaded on the current CPU's
2861 * MMU and that there are no stale TLB entries.
2862 *
2863 * => The caller should disable kernel preemption or do check-and-retry
2864 * to prevent a preemption from undoing our efforts.
2865 * => This function may block.
2866 */
2867void
2868pmap_load(void)
2869{
2870 struct cpu_info *ci;
2871 struct pmap *pmap, *oldpmap;
2872 struct lwp *l;
2873 struct pcb *pcb;
2874 cpuid_t cid;
2875 uint64_t ncsw;
2876
2877 kpreempt_disable();
2878 retry:
2879 ci = curcpu();
2880 if (!ci->ci_want_pmapload) {
2881 kpreempt_enable();
2882 return;
2883 }
2884 l = ci->ci_curlwp;
2885 ncsw = l->l_ncsw;
2886
2887 /* should be able to take ipis. */
2888 KASSERT(ci->ci_ilevel < IPL_HIGH);
2889#ifdef XENPV
2890 /* Check to see if interrupts are enabled (ie; no events are masked) */
2891 KASSERT(x86_read_psl() == 0);
2892#else
2893 KASSERT((x86_read_psl() & PSL_I) != 0);
2894#endif
2895
2896 KASSERT(l != NULL);
2897 pmap = vm_map_pmap(&l->l_proc->p_vmspace->vm_map);
2898 KASSERT(pmap != pmap_kernel());
2899 oldpmap = ci->ci_pmap;
2900 pcb = lwp_getpcb(l);
2901
2902 if (pmap == oldpmap) {
2903 pmap_reactivate(pmap);
2904 ci->ci_want_pmapload = 0;
2905 kpreempt_enable();
2906 return;
2907 }
2908
2909 /*
2910 * Acquire a reference to the new pmap and perform the switch.
2911 */
2912
2913 pmap_reference(pmap);
2914
2915 cid = cpu_index(ci);
2916 kcpuset_atomic_clear(oldpmap->pm_cpus, cid);
2917 kcpuset_atomic_clear(oldpmap->pm_kernel_cpus, cid);
2918
2919 KASSERT_PDIRPA(oldpmap);
2920 KASSERT(!kcpuset_isset(pmap->pm_cpus, cid));
2921 KASSERT(!kcpuset_isset(pmap->pm_kernel_cpus, cid));
2922
2923 /*
2924 * Mark the pmap in use by this CPU. Again, we must synchronize
2925 * with TLB shootdown interrupts, so set the state VALID first,
2926 * then register us for shootdown events on this pmap.
2927 */
2928 ci->ci_tlbstate = TLBSTATE_VALID;
2929 kcpuset_atomic_set(pmap->pm_cpus, cid);
2930 kcpuset_atomic_set(pmap->pm_kernel_cpus, cid);
2931 ci->ci_pmap = pmap;
2932
2933 /*
2934 * update tss. now that we have registered for invalidations
2935 * from other CPUs, we're good to load the page tables.
2936 */
2937#ifdef PAE
2938 pcb->pcb_cr3 = ci->ci_pae_l3_pdirpa;
2939#else
2940 pcb->pcb_cr3 = pmap_pdirpa(pmap, 0);
2941#endif
2942
2943#ifdef i386
2944#ifndef XENPV
2945 ci->ci_tss->tss.tss_ldt = pmap->pm_ldt_sel;
2946 ci->ci_tss->tss.tss_cr3 = pcb->pcb_cr3;
2947#endif
2948#endif
2949
2950 lldt(pmap->pm_ldt_sel);
2951
2952 cpu_load_pmap(pmap, oldpmap);
2953
2954 ci->ci_want_pmapload = 0;
2955
2956 /*
2957 * we're now running with the new pmap. drop the reference
2958 * to the old pmap. if we block, we need to go around again.
2959 */
2960
2961 pmap_destroy(oldpmap);
2962 if (l->l_ncsw != ncsw) {
2963 goto retry;
2964 }
2965
2966 kpreempt_enable();
2967}
2968
2969/*
2970 * pmap_deactivate: deactivate a process' pmap.
2971 *
2972 * => Must be called with kernel preemption disabled (high IPL is enough).
2973 */
2974void
2975pmap_deactivate(struct lwp *l)
2976{
2977 struct pmap *pmap;
2978 struct cpu_info *ci;
2979
2980 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
2981
2982 if (l != curlwp) {
2983 return;
2984 }
2985
2986 /*
2987 * Wait for pending TLB shootdowns to complete. Necessary because
2988 * TLB shootdown state is per-CPU, and the LWP may be coming off
2989 * the CPU before it has a chance to call pmap_update(), e.g. due
2990 * to kernel preemption or blocking routine in between.
2991 */
2992 pmap_tlb_shootnow();
2993
2994 ci = curcpu();
2995
2996 if (ci->ci_want_pmapload) {
2997 /*
2998 * ci_want_pmapload means that our pmap is not loaded on
2999 * the CPU or TLB might be stale. note that pmap_kernel()
3000 * is always considered loaded.
3001 */
3002 KASSERT(vm_map_pmap(&l->l_proc->p_vmspace->vm_map)
3003 != pmap_kernel());
3004 KASSERT(vm_map_pmap(&l->l_proc->p_vmspace->vm_map)
3005 != ci->ci_pmap || ci->ci_tlbstate != TLBSTATE_VALID);
3006
3007 /*
3008 * userspace has not been touched.
3009 * nothing to do here.
3010 */
3011
3012 ci->ci_want_pmapload = 0;
3013 return;
3014 }
3015
3016 pmap = vm_map_pmap(&l->l_proc->p_vmspace->vm_map);
3017
3018 if (pmap == pmap_kernel()) {
3019 return;
3020 }
3021
3022 KASSERT_PDIRPA(pmap);
3023 KASSERT(ci->ci_pmap == pmap);
3024
3025 /*
3026 * we aren't interested in TLB invalidations for this pmap,
3027 * at least for the time being.
3028 */
3029
3030 KASSERT(ci->ci_tlbstate == TLBSTATE_VALID);
3031 ci->ci_tlbstate = TLBSTATE_LAZY;
3032}
3033
3034/*
3035 * some misc. functions
3036 */
3037
3038bool
3039pmap_pdes_valid(vaddr_t va, pd_entry_t * const *pdes, pd_entry_t *lastpde,
3040 int *lastlvl)
3041{
3042 unsigned long index;
3043 pd_entry_t pde;
3044 int i;
3045
3046 for (i = PTP_LEVELS; i > 1; i--) {
3047 index = pl_i(va, i);
3048 pde = pdes[i - 2][index];
3049 if ((pde & PTE_P) == 0) {
3050 *lastlvl = i;
3051 return false;
3052 }
3053 if (pde & PTE_PS)
3054 break;
3055 }
3056 if (lastpde != NULL)
3057 *lastpde = pde;
3058 *lastlvl = i;
3059 return true;
3060}
3061
3062/*
3063 * pmap_extract: extract a PA for the given VA
3064 */
3065bool
3066pmap_extract(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va, paddr_t *pap)
3067{
3068 pt_entry_t *ptes, pte;
3069 pd_entry_t pde;
3070 pd_entry_t * const *pdes;
3071 struct pmap *pmap2;
3072 struct cpu_info *ci;
3073 paddr_t pa;
3074 lwp_t *l;
3075 bool hard, rv;
3076 int lvl;
3077
3078 if (__predict_false(pmap->pm_extract != NULL)) {
3079 return (*pmap->pm_extract)(pmap, va, pap);
3080 }
3081
3082#ifdef __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP
3083 if (va >= PMAP_DIRECT_BASE && va < PMAP_DIRECT_END) {
3084 if (pap != NULL) {
3085 *pap = PMAP_DIRECT_UNMAP(va);
3086 }
3087 return true;
3088 }
3089#endif
3090
3091 rv = false;
3092 pa = 0;
3093 l = curlwp;
3094
3095 kpreempt_disable();
3096 ci = l->l_cpu;
3097 if (pmap == pmap_kernel() ||
3098 __predict_true(!ci->ci_want_pmapload && ci->ci_pmap == pmap)) {
3099 /*
3100 * no need to lock, because it's pmap_kernel() or our
3101 * own pmap and is active. if a user pmap, the caller
3102 * will hold the vm_map write/read locked and so prevent
3103 * entries from disappearing while we are here. ptps
3104 * can disappear via pmap_remove() and pmap_protect(),
3105 * but they are called with the vm_map write locked.
3106 */
3107 hard = false;
3108 ptes = PTE_BASE;
3109 pdes = normal_pdes;
3110 } else {
3111 /* we lose, do it the hard way. */
3112 hard = true;
3113 pmap_map_ptes(pmap, &pmap2, &ptes, &pdes);
3114 }
3115 if (pmap_pdes_valid(va, pdes, &pde, &lvl)) {
3116 if (lvl == 2) {
3117 pa = (pde & PTE_LGFRAME) | (va & (NBPD_L2 - 1));
3118 rv = true;
3119 } else {
3120 KASSERT(lvl == 1);
3121 pte = ptes[pl1_i(va)];
3122 if (__predict_true((pte & PTE_P) != 0)) {
3123 pa = pmap_pte2pa(pte) | (va & (NBPD_L1 - 1));
3124 rv = true;
3125 }
3126 }
3127 }
3128 if (__predict_false(hard)) {
3129 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2);
3130 }
3131 kpreempt_enable();
3132 if (pap != NULL) {
3133 *pap = pa;
3134 }
3135 return rv;
3136}
3137
3138/*
3139 * vtophys: virtual address to physical address. For use by
3140 * machine-dependent code only.
3141 */
3142paddr_t
3143vtophys(vaddr_t va)
3144{
3145 paddr_t pa;
3146
3147 if (pmap_extract(pmap_kernel(), va, &pa) == true)
3148 return pa;
3149 return 0;
3150}
3151
3152__strict_weak_alias(pmap_extract_ma, pmap_extract);
3153
3154#ifdef XENPV
3155/*
3156 * vtomach: virtual address to machine address. For use by
3157 * machine-dependent code only.
3158 */
3159paddr_t
3160vtomach(vaddr_t va)
3161{
3162 paddr_t pa;
3163
3164 if (pmap_extract_ma(pmap_kernel(), va, &pa) == true)
3165 return pa;
3166 return 0;
3167}
3168#endif
