3170/*
3171 * pmap_virtual_space: used during bootup [pmap_steal_memory] to
3172 * determine the bounds of the kernel virtual addess space.
3173 */
3174void
3175pmap_virtual_space(vaddr_t *startp, vaddr_t *endp)
3176{
3177 *startp = virtual_avail;
3178 *endp = virtual_end;
3179}
3180
3181void
3182pmap_zero_page(paddr_t pa)
3183{
3184#if defined(__HAVE_DIRECT_MAP)
3185 pagezero(PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(pa));
3186#else
3187#if defined(XENPV)
3188 if (XEN_VERSION_SUPPORTED(3, 4))
3189 xen_pagezero(pa);
3190#endif
3191 struct cpu_info *ci;
3192 pt_entry_t *zpte;
3193 vaddr_t zerova;
3194
3195 const pd_entry_t pteflags = PTE_P | PTE_W | pmap_pg_nx | PTE_D | PTE_A;
3196
3197 kpreempt_disable();
3198
3199 ci = curcpu();
3200 zerova = ci->vpage[VPAGE_ZER];
3201 zpte = ci->vpage_pte[VPAGE_ZER];
3202
3203 KASSERTMSG(!*zpte, "pmap_zero_page: lock botch");
3204
3205 pmap_pte_set(zpte, pmap_pa2pte(pa) | pteflags);
3206 pmap_pte_flush();
3207 pmap_update_pg(zerova); /* flush TLB */
3208
3209 memset((void *)zerova, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
3210
3211#if defined(DIAGNOSTIC) || defined(XENPV)
3212 pmap_pte_set(zpte, 0); /* zap ! */
3213 pmap_pte_flush();
3214#endif
3215
3216 kpreempt_enable();
3217#endif /* defined(__HAVE_DIRECT_MAP) */
3218}
3219
3220/*
3221 * pmap_pagezeroidle: the same, for the idle loop page zero'er.
3222 * Returns true if the page was zero'd, false if we aborted for
3223 * some reason.
3224 */
3225bool
3226pmap_pageidlezero(paddr_t pa)
3227{
3228#ifdef __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP
3229 KASSERT(cpu_feature[0] & CPUID_SSE2);
3230 return sse2_idlezero_page((void *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(pa));
3231#else
3232 struct cpu_info *ci;
3233 pt_entry_t *zpte;
3234 vaddr_t zerova;
3235 bool rv;
3236
3237 const pd_entry_t pteflags = PTE_P | PTE_W | pmap_pg_nx | PTE_D | PTE_A;
3238
3239 ci = curcpu();
3240 zerova = ci->vpage[VPAGE_ZER];
3241 zpte = ci->vpage_pte[VPAGE_ZER];
3242
3243 KASSERT(cpu_feature[0] & CPUID_SSE2);
3244 KASSERT(*zpte == 0);
3245
3246 pmap_pte_set(zpte, pmap_pa2pte(pa) | pteflags);
3247 pmap_pte_flush();
3248 pmap_update_pg(zerova); /* flush TLB */
3249
3250 rv = sse2_idlezero_page((void *)zerova);
3251
3252#if defined(DIAGNOSTIC) || defined(XENPV)
3253 pmap_pte_set(zpte, 0); /* zap ! */
3254 pmap_pte_flush();
3255#endif
3256
3257 return rv;
3258#endif
3259}
3260
3261void
3262pmap_copy_page(paddr_t srcpa, paddr_t dstpa)
3263{
3264#if defined(__HAVE_DIRECT_MAP)
3265 vaddr_t srcva = PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(srcpa);
3266 vaddr_t dstva = PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(dstpa);
3267
3268 memcpy((void *)dstva, (void *)srcva, PAGE_SIZE);
3269#else
3270#if defined(XENPV)
3271 if (XEN_VERSION_SUPPORTED(3, 4)) {
3272 xen_copy_page(srcpa, dstpa);
3273 return;
3274 }
3275#endif
3276 struct cpu_info *ci;
3277 pt_entry_t *srcpte, *dstpte;
3278 vaddr_t srcva, dstva;
3279
3280 const pd_entry_t pteflags = PTE_P | PTE_W | pmap_pg_nx | PTE_A;
3281
3282 kpreempt_disable();
3283
3284 ci = curcpu();
3285 srcva = ci->vpage[VPAGE_SRC];
3286 dstva = ci->vpage[VPAGE_DST];
3287 srcpte = ci->vpage_pte[VPAGE_SRC];
3288 dstpte = ci->vpage_pte[VPAGE_DST];
3289
3290 KASSERT(*srcpte == 0 && *dstpte == 0);
3291
3292 pmap_pte_set(srcpte, pmap_pa2pte(srcpa) | pteflags);
3293 pmap_pte_set(dstpte, pmap_pa2pte(dstpa) | pteflags | PTE_D);
3294 pmap_pte_flush();
3295 pmap_update_pg(srcva);
3296 pmap_update_pg(dstva);
3297
3298 memcpy((void *)dstva, (void *)srcva, PAGE_SIZE);
3299
3300#if defined(DIAGNOSTIC) || defined(XENPV)
3301 pmap_pte_set(srcpte, 0);
3302 pmap_pte_set(dstpte, 0);
3303 pmap_pte_flush();
3304#endif
3305
3306 kpreempt_enable();
3307#endif /* defined(__HAVE_DIRECT_MAP) */
3308}
3309
3310static pt_entry_t *
3311pmap_map_ptp(struct vm_page *ptp)
3312{
3313#ifdef __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP
3314 return (void *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(ptp));
3315#else
3316 struct cpu_info *ci;
3317 pt_entry_t *ptppte;
3318 vaddr_t ptpva;
3319
3320 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
3321
3322#ifndef XENPV
3323 const pd_entry_t pteflags = PTE_P | PTE_W | pmap_pg_nx | PTE_A | PTE_D;
3324#else
3325 const pd_entry_t pteflags = PTE_P | pmap_pg_nx | PTE_A | PTE_D;
3326#endif
3327
3328 ci = curcpu();
3329 ptpva = ci->vpage[VPAGE_PTP];
3330 ptppte = ci->vpage_pte[VPAGE_PTP];
3331
3332 pmap_pte_set(ptppte, pmap_pa2pte(VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(ptp)) | pteflags);
3333
3334 pmap_pte_flush();
3335 pmap_update_pg(ptpva);
3336
3337 return (pt_entry_t *)ptpva;
3338#endif
3339}
3340
3341static void
3342pmap_unmap_ptp(void)
3343{
3344#ifndef __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP
3345#if defined(DIAGNOSTIC) || defined(XENPV)
3346 struct cpu_info *ci;
3347 pt_entry_t *pte;
3348
3349 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
3350
3351 ci = curcpu();
3352 pte = ci->vpage_pte[VPAGE_PTP];
3353
3354 if (*pte != 0) {
3355 pmap_pte_set(pte, 0);
3356 pmap_pte_flush();
3357 }
3358#endif
3359#endif
3360}
3361
3362static pt_entry_t *
3363pmap_map_pte(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t va)
3364{
3365
3366 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
3367 if (pmap_is_curpmap(pmap)) {
3368 return &PTE_BASE[pl1_i(va)]; /* (k)vtopte */
3369 }
3370 KASSERT(ptp != NULL);
3371 return pmap_map_ptp(ptp) + pl1_pi(va);
3372}
3373
3374static void
3375pmap_unmap_pte(void)
3376{
3377
3378 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
3379
3380 pmap_unmap_ptp();
3381}
3382
3383/*
3384 * p m a p r e m o v e f u n c t i o n s
3385 *
3386 * functions that remove mappings
3387 */
3388
3389/*
3390 * pmap_remove_ptes: remove PTEs from a PTP
3391 *
3392 * => caller must hold pmap's lock
3393 * => PTP must be mapped into KVA
3394 * => PTP should be null if pmap == pmap_kernel()
3395 * => must be called with kernel preemption disabled
3396 * => returns composite pte if at least one page should be shot down
3397 */
3398static void
3399pmap_remove_ptes(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t ptpva,
3400 vaddr_t startva, vaddr_t endva, struct pv_entry **pv_tofree)
3401{
3402 pt_entry_t *pte = (pt_entry_t *)ptpva;
3403
3404 KASSERT(pmap == pmap_kernel() || mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
3405 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
3406
3407 /*
3408 * note that ptpva points to the PTE that maps startva. this may
3409 * or may not be the first PTE in the PTP.
3410 *
3411 * we loop through the PTP while there are still PTEs to look at
3412 * and the wire_count is greater than 1 (because we use the wire_count
3413 * to keep track of the number of real PTEs in the PTP).
3414 */
3415 while (startva < endva && (ptp == NULL || ptp->wire_count > 1)) {
3416 (void)pmap_remove_pte(pmap, ptp, pte, startva, pv_tofree);
3417 startva += PAGE_SIZE;
3418 pte++;
3419 }
3420}
3421
3422static inline uint8_t
3423pmap_pte_to_pp_attrs(pt_entry_t pte)
3424{
3425 uint8_t ret = 0;
3426 if (pte & PTE_D)
3427 ret |= PP_ATTRS_M;
3428 if (pte & PTE_A)
3429 ret |= PP_ATTRS_U;
3430 if (pte & PTE_W)
3431 ret |= PP_ATTRS_W;
3432 return ret;
3433}
3434
3435static inline pt_entry_t
3436pmap_pp_attrs_to_pte(uint8_t attrs)
3437{
3438 pt_entry_t pte = 0;
3439 if (attrs & PP_ATTRS_M)
3440 pte |= PTE_D;
3441 if (attrs & PP_ATTRS_U)
3442 pte |= PTE_A;
3443 if (attrs & PP_ATTRS_W)
3444 pte |= PTE_W;
3445 return pte;
3446}
3447
3448/*
3449 * pmap_remove_pte: remove a single PTE from a PTP.
3450 *
3451 * => caller must hold pmap's lock
3452 * => PTP must be mapped into KVA
3453 * => PTP should be null if pmap == pmap_kernel()
3454 * => returns true if we removed a mapping
3455 * => must be called with kernel preemption disabled
3456 */
3457static bool
3458pmap_remove_pte(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, pt_entry_t *pte,
3459 vaddr_t va, struct pv_entry **pv_tofree)
3460{
3461 struct pv_entry *pve;
3462 struct vm_page *pg;
3463 struct pmap_page *pp;
3464 pt_entry_t opte;
3465
3466 KASSERT(pmap == pmap_kernel() || mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
3467 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
3468
3469 if (!pmap_valid_entry(*pte)) {
3470 /* VA not mapped. */
3471 return false;
3472 }
3473
3474 /* Atomically save the old PTE and zap it. */
3475 opte = pmap_pte_testset(pte, 0);
3476 if (!pmap_valid_entry(opte)) {
3477 return false;
3478 }
3479
3480 pmap_exec_account(pmap, va, opte, 0);
3481 pmap_stats_update_bypte(pmap, 0, opte);
3482
3483 if (ptp) {
3484 /*
3485 * Dropping a PTE. Make sure that the PDE is flushed.
3486 */
3487 ptp->wire_count--;
3488 if (ptp->wire_count <= 1) {
3489 opte |= PTE_A;
3490 }
3491 }
3492
3493 if ((opte & PTE_A) != 0) {
3494 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, va, opte, TLBSHOOT_REMOVE_PTE);
3495 }
3496
3497 /*
3498 * If we are not on a pv_head list - we are done.
3499 */
3500 if ((opte & PG_PVLIST) == 0) {
3501#ifndef DOM0OPS
3502 KASSERTMSG((PHYS_TO_VM_PAGE(pmap_pte2pa(opte)) == NULL),
3503 "managed page without PG_PVLIST for %#"PRIxVADDR, va);
3504 KASSERTMSG((pmap_pv_tracked(pmap_pte2pa(opte)) == NULL),
3505 "pv-tracked page without PG_PVLIST for %#"PRIxVADDR, va);
3506#endif
3507 return true;
3508 }
3509
3510 if ((pg = PHYS_TO_VM_PAGE(pmap_pte2pa(opte))) != NULL) {
3511 KASSERT(uvm_page_locked_p(pg));
3512 pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(pg);
3513 } else if ((pp = pmap_pv_tracked(pmap_pte2pa(opte))) == NULL) {
3514 paddr_t pa = pmap_pte2pa(opte);
3515 panic("%s: PG_PVLIST with pv-untracked page"
3516 " va = %#"PRIxVADDR"pa = %#"PRIxPADDR" (%#"PRIxPADDR")",
3517 __func__, va, pa, atop(pa));
3518 }
3519
3520 /* Sync R/M bits. */
3521 pp->pp_attrs |= pmap_pte_to_pp_attrs(opte);
3522 pve = pmap_remove_pv(pp, ptp, va);
3523
3524 if (pve) {
3525 pve->pve_next = *pv_tofree;
3526 *pv_tofree = pve;
3527 }
3528 return true;
3529}
3530
3531/*
3532 * pmap_remove: mapping removal function.
3533 *
3534 * => caller should not be holding any pmap locks
3535 */
3536void
3537pmap_remove(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t sva, vaddr_t eva)
3538{
3539 pt_entry_t *ptes;
3540 pd_entry_t pde;
3541 pd_entry_t * const *pdes;
3542 struct pv_entry *pv_tofree = NULL;
3543 bool result;
3544 paddr_t ptppa;
3545 vaddr_t blkendva, va = sva;
3546 struct vm_page *ptp;
3547 struct pmap *pmap2;
3548 int lvl;
3549
3550 if (__predict_false(pmap->pm_remove != NULL)) {
3551 (*pmap->pm_remove)(pmap, sva, eva);
3552 return;
3553 }
3554
3555 kpreempt_disable();
3556 pmap_map_ptes(pmap, &pmap2, &ptes, &pdes); /* locks pmap */
3557
3558 /*
3559 * removing one page? take shortcut function.
3560 */
3561
3562 if (va + PAGE_SIZE == eva) {
3563 if (pmap_pdes_valid(va, pdes, &pde, &lvl)) {
3564 KASSERT(lvl == 1);
3565
3566 /* PA of the PTP */
3567 ptppa = pmap_pte2pa(pde);
3568
3569 /* Get PTP if non-kernel mapping. */
3570 if (pmap != pmap_kernel()) {
3571 ptp = pmap_find_ptp(pmap, va, ptppa, 1);
3572 KASSERTMSG(ptp != NULL,
3573 "%s: unmanaged PTP detected", __func__);
3574 } else {
3575 /* Never free kernel PTPs. */
3576 ptp = NULL;
3577 }
3578
3579 result = pmap_remove_pte(pmap, ptp,
3580 &ptes[pl1_i(va)], va, &pv_tofree);
3581
3582 /*
3583 * if mapping removed and the PTP is no longer
3584 * being used, free it!
3585 */
3586
3587 if (result && ptp && ptp->wire_count <= 1)
3588 pmap_free_ptp(pmap, ptp, va, ptes, pdes);
3589 }
3590 } else for (/* null */ ; va < eva ; va = blkendva) {
3591 /* determine range of block */
3592 blkendva = x86_round_pdr(va+1);
3593 if (blkendva > eva)
3594 blkendva = eva;
3595
3596 if (!pmap_pdes_valid(va, pdes, &pde, &lvl)) {
3597 /* Skip a range corresponding to an invalid pde. */
3598 blkendva = (va & ptp_frames[lvl - 1]) + nbpd[lvl - 1];
3599 continue;
3600 }
3601 KASSERT(lvl == 1);
3602
3603 /* PA of the PTP */
3604 ptppa = pmap_pte2pa(pde);
3605
3606 /* Get PTP if non-kernel mapping. */
3607 if (pmap != pmap_kernel()) {
3608 ptp = pmap_find_ptp(pmap, va, ptppa, 1);
3609 KASSERTMSG(ptp != NULL, "%s: unmanaged PTP detected",
3610 __func__);
3611 } else {
3612 /* Never free kernel PTPs. */
3613 ptp = NULL;
3614 }
3615
3616 pmap_remove_ptes(pmap, ptp, (vaddr_t)&ptes[pl1_i(va)], va,
3617 blkendva, &pv_tofree);
3618
3619 /* If PTP is no longer being used, free it. */
3620 if (ptp && ptp->wire_count <= 1) {
3621 pmap_free_ptp(pmap, ptp, va, ptes, pdes);
3622 }
3623 }
3624 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2); /* unlock pmap */
3625 kpreempt_enable();
3626
3627 /* Now we free unused PVs */
3628 if (pv_tofree)
3629 pmap_free_pvs(pv_tofree);
3630}
3631
3632/*
3633 * pmap_sync_pv: clear pte bits and return the old value of the pp_attrs.
3634 *
3635 * => The 'clearbits' parameter is either ~0 or PP_ATTRS_...
3636 * => Caller should disable kernel preemption.
3637 * => issues tlb shootdowns if necessary.
3638 */
3639static int
3640pmap_sync_pv(struct pv_pte *pvpte, paddr_t pa, int clearbits, uint8_t *oattrs,
3641 pt_entry_t *optep)
3642{
3643 struct pmap *pmap;
3644 struct vm_page *ptp;
3645 vaddr_t va;
3646 pt_entry_t *ptep;
3647 pt_entry_t opte;
3648 pt_entry_t npte;
3649 pt_entry_t expect;
3650 bool need_shootdown;
3651
3652 ptp = pvpte->pte_ptp;
3653 va = pvpte->pte_va;
3654 KASSERT(ptp == NULL || ptp->uobject != NULL);
3655 KASSERT(ptp == NULL || ptp_va2o(va, 1) == ptp->offset);
3656 pmap = ptp_to_pmap(ptp);
3657 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
3658
3659 if (__predict_false(pmap->pm_sync_pv != NULL)) {
3660 return (*pmap->pm_sync_pv)(ptp, va, pa, clearbits, oattrs,
3661 optep);
3662 }
3663
3664 expect = pmap_pa2pte(pa) | PTE_P;
3665
3666 if (clearbits != ~0) {
3667 KASSERT((clearbits & ~(PP_ATTRS_M|PP_ATTRS_U|PP_ATTRS_W)) == 0);
3668 clearbits = pmap_pp_attrs_to_pte(clearbits);
3669 }
3670
3671 ptep = pmap_map_pte(pmap, ptp, va);
3672 do {
3673 opte = *ptep;
3674 KASSERT((opte & (PTE_D | PTE_A)) != PTE_D);
3675 KASSERT((opte & (PTE_A | PTE_P)) != PTE_A);
3676 KASSERT(opte == 0 || (opte & PTE_P) != 0);
3677 if ((opte & (PTE_FRAME | PTE_P)) != expect) {
3678 /*
3679 * We lost a race with a V->P operation like
3680 * pmap_remove(). Wait for the competitor
3681 * reflecting pte bits into mp_attrs.
3682 *
3683 * Issue a redundant TLB shootdown so that
3684 * we can wait for its completion.
3685 */
3686 pmap_unmap_pte();
3687 if (clearbits != 0) {
3688 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, va,
3689 (pmap == pmap_kernel() ? PTE_G : 0),
3690 TLBSHOOT_SYNC_PV1);
3691 }
3692 return EAGAIN;
3693 }
3694
3695 /*
3696 * Check if there's anything to do on this PTE.
3697 */
3698 if ((opte & clearbits) == 0) {
3699 need_shootdown = false;
3700 break;
3701 }
3702
3703 /*
3704 * We need a shootdown if the PTE is cached (PTE_A) ...
3705 * ... Unless we are clearing only the PTE_W bit and
3706 * it isn't cached as RW (PTE_D).
3707 */
3708 need_shootdown = (opte & PTE_A) != 0 &&
3709 !(clearbits == PTE_W && (opte & PTE_D) == 0);
3710
3711 npte = opte & ~clearbits;
3712
3713 /*
3714 * If we need a shootdown anyway, clear PTE_A and PTE_D.
3715 */
3716 if (need_shootdown) {
3717 npte &= ~(PTE_A | PTE_D);
3718 }
3719 KASSERT((npte & (PTE_D | PTE_A)) != PTE_D);
3720 KASSERT((npte & (PTE_A | PTE_P)) != PTE_A);
3721 KASSERT(npte == 0 || (opte & PTE_P) != 0);
3722 } while (pmap_pte_cas(ptep, opte, npte) != opte);
3723
3724 if (need_shootdown) {
3725 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, va, opte, TLBSHOOT_SYNC_PV2);
3726 }
3727 pmap_unmap_pte();
3728
3729 *oattrs = pmap_pte_to_pp_attrs(opte);
3730 if (optep != NULL)
3731 *optep = opte;
3732 return 0;
3733}
3734
3735static inline void
3736pmap_pp_remove_ent(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, pt_entry_t opte,
3737 vaddr_t va)
3738{
3739 struct pmap *pmap2;
3740 pt_entry_t *ptes;
3741 pd_entry_t * const *pdes;
3742
3743 pmap_map_ptes(pmap, &pmap2, &ptes, &pdes);
3744 pmap_stats_update_bypte(pmap, 0, opte);
3745 ptp->wire_count--;
3746 if (ptp->wire_count <= 1) {
3747 pmap_free_ptp(pmap, ptp, va, ptes, pdes);
3748 }
3749 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2);
3750}
3751
3752static void
3753pmap_pp_remove(struct pmap_page *pp, paddr_t pa)
3754{
3755 struct pv_pte *pvpte;
3756 struct pv_entry *killlist = NULL;
3757 struct vm_page *ptp;
3758 uint8_t oattrs;
3759 int count;
3760
3761 count = SPINLOCK_BACKOFF_MIN;
3762 kpreempt_disable();
3763startover:
3764 while ((pvpte = pv_pte_first(pp)) != NULL) {
3765 struct pmap *pmap;
3766 struct pv_entry *pve;
3767 pt_entry_t opte;
3768 vaddr_t va;
3769 int error;
3770
3771 /*
3772 * Add a reference to the pmap before clearing the pte.
3773 * Otherwise the pmap can disappear behind us.
3774 */
3775 ptp = pvpte->pte_ptp;
3776 pmap = ptp_to_pmap(ptp);
3777 if (ptp != NULL) {
3778 pmap_reference(pmap);
3779 }
3780
3781 error = pmap_sync_pv(pvpte, pa, ~0, &oattrs, &opte);
3782 if (error == EAGAIN) {
3783 int hold_count;
3784 KERNEL_UNLOCK_ALL(curlwp, &hold_count);
3785 if (ptp != NULL) {
3786 pmap_destroy(pmap);
3787 }
3788 SPINLOCK_BACKOFF(count);
3789 KERNEL_LOCK(hold_count, curlwp);
3790 goto startover;
3791 }
3792
3793 pp->pp_attrs |= oattrs;
3794 va = pvpte->pte_va;
3795 pve = pmap_remove_pv(pp, ptp, va);
3796
3797 /* Update the PTP reference count. Free if last reference. */
3798 if (ptp != NULL) {
3799 KASSERT(pmap != pmap_kernel());
3800 pmap_tlb_shootnow();
3801 if (__predict_false(pmap->pm_pp_remove_ent != NULL)) {
3802 (*pmap->pm_pp_remove_ent)(pmap, ptp, opte, va);
3803 } else {
3804 pmap_pp_remove_ent(pmap, ptp, opte, va);
3805 }
3806 pmap_destroy(pmap);
3807 } else {
3808 KASSERT(pmap == pmap_kernel());
3809 pmap_stats_update_bypte(pmap, 0, opte);
3810 }
3811
3812 if (pve != NULL) {
3813 pve->pve_next = killlist; /* mark it for death */
3814 killlist = pve;
3815 }
3816 }
3817 pmap_tlb_shootnow();
3818 kpreempt_enable();
3819
3820 /* Now free unused pvs. */
3821 pmap_free_pvs(killlist);
3822}
3823
3824/*
3825 * pmap_page_remove: remove a managed vm_page from all pmaps that map it
3826 *
3827 * => R/M bits are sync'd back to attrs
3828 */
3829void
3830pmap_page_remove(struct vm_page *pg)
3831{
3832 struct pmap_page *pp;
3833 paddr_t pa;
3834
3835 KASSERT(uvm_page_locked_p(pg));
3836
3837 pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(pg);
3838 pa = VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(pg);
3839 pmap_pp_remove(pp, pa);
3840}
3841
3842/*
3843 * pmap_pv_remove: remove an unmanaged pv-tracked page from all pmaps
3844 * that map it
3845 */
3846void
3847pmap_pv_remove(paddr_t pa)
3848{
3849 struct pmap_page *pp;
3850
3851 pp = pmap_pv_tracked(pa);
3852 if (pp == NULL)
3853 panic("%s: page not pv-tracked: %#"PRIxPADDR, __func__, pa);
3854 pmap_pp_remove(pp, pa);
3855}
3856
3857/*
3858 * p m a p a t t r i b u t e f u n c t i o n s
3859 * functions that test/change managed page's attributes
3860 * since a page can be mapped multiple times we must check each PTE that
3861 * maps it by going down the pv lists.
3862 */
3863
3864/*
3865 * pmap_test_attrs: test a page's attributes
3866 */
3867bool
3868pmap_test_attrs(struct vm_page *pg, unsigned testbits)
3869{
3870 struct pmap_page *pp;
3871 struct pv_pte *pvpte;
3872 uint8_t oattrs;
3873 u_int result;
3874 paddr_t pa;
3875
3876 KASSERT(uvm_page_locked_p(pg));
3877
3878 pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(pg);
3879 if ((pp->pp_attrs & testbits) != 0) {
3880 return true;
3881 }
3882 pa = VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(pg);
3883 kpreempt_disable();
3884 for (pvpte = pv_pte_first(pp); pvpte; pvpte = pv_pte_next(pp, pvpte)) {
3885 int error;
3886
3887 if ((pp->pp_attrs & testbits) != 0) {
3888 break;
3889 }
3890 error = pmap_sync_pv(pvpte, pa, 0, &oattrs, NULL);
3891 if (error == 0) {
3892 pp->pp_attrs |= oattrs;
3893 }
3894 }
3895 result = pp->pp_attrs & testbits;
3896 kpreempt_enable();
3897
3898 /*
3899 * note that we will exit the for loop with a non-null pve if
3900 * we have found the bits we are testing for.
3901 */
3902
3903 return result != 0;
3904}
3905
3906static bool
3907pmap_pp_clear_attrs(struct pmap_page *pp, paddr_t pa, unsigned clearbits)
3908{
3909 struct pv_pte *pvpte;
3910 uint8_t oattrs;
3911 u_int result;
3912 int count;
3913
3914 count = SPINLOCK_BACKOFF_MIN;
3915 kpreempt_disable();
3916startover:
3917 for (pvpte = pv_pte_first(pp); pvpte; pvpte = pv_pte_next(pp, pvpte)) {
3918 int error;
3919
3920 error = pmap_sync_pv(pvpte, pa, clearbits, &oattrs, NULL);
3921 if (error == EAGAIN) {
3922 int hold_count;
3923 KERNEL_UNLOCK_ALL(curlwp, &hold_count);
3924 SPINLOCK_BACKOFF(count);
3925 KERNEL_LOCK(hold_count, curlwp);
3926 goto startover;
3927 }
3928 pp->pp_attrs |= oattrs;
3929 }
3930 result = pp->pp_attrs & clearbits;
3931 pp->pp_attrs &= ~clearbits;
3932 pmap_tlb_shootnow();
3933 kpreempt_enable();
3934
3935 return result != 0;
3936}
3937
3938/*
3939 * pmap_clear_attrs: clear the specified attribute for a page.
3940 *
3941 * => we return true if we cleared one of the bits we were asked to
3942 */
3943bool
3944pmap_clear_attrs(struct vm_page *pg, unsigned clearbits)
3945{
3946 struct pmap_page *pp;
3947 paddr_t pa;
3948
3949 KASSERT(uvm_page_locked_p(pg));
3950
3951 pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(pg);
3952 pa = VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(pg);
3953
3954 return pmap_pp_clear_attrs(pp, pa, clearbits);
3955}
3956
3957/*
3958 * pmap_pv_clear_attrs: clear the specified attributes for an unmanaged
3959 * pv-tracked page.
3960 */
3961bool
3962pmap_pv_clear_attrs(paddr_t pa, unsigned clearbits)
3963{
3964 struct pmap_page *pp;
3965
3966 pp = pmap_pv_tracked(pa);
3967 if (pp == NULL)
3968 panic("%s: page not pv-tracked: %#"PRIxPADDR, __func__, pa);
3969
3970 return pmap_pp_clear_attrs(pp, pa, clearbits);
3971}
3972
3973/*
3974 * p m a p p r o t e c t i o n f u n c t i o n s
3975 */
3976
3977/*
3978 * pmap_page_protect: change the protection of all recorded mappings
3979 * of a managed page
3980 *
3981 * => NOTE: this is an inline function in pmap.h
3982 */
3983
3984/* see pmap.h */
3985
3986/*
3987 * pmap_pv_protect: change the protection of all recorded mappings
3988 * of an unmanaged pv-tracked page
3989 *
3990 * => NOTE: this is an inline function in pmap.h
3991 */
3992
3993/* see pmap.h */
3994
3995/*
3996 * pmap_protect: set the protection in of the pages in a pmap
3997 *
3998 * => NOTE: this is an inline function in pmap.h
3999 */
4000
4001/* see pmap.h */
4002
4003/*
4004 * pmap_write_protect: write-protect pages in a pmap.
4005 *
4006 * Note for Xen-amd64. Xen automatically adds PTE_U to the kernel pages, but we
4007 * don't need to remove this bit when re-entering the PTEs here: Xen tracks the
4008 * kernel pages with a reserved bit (_PAGE_GUEST_KERNEL), so even if PTE_U is
4009 * present the page will still be considered as a kernel page, and the privilege
4010 * separation will be enforced correctly.
4011 */
4012void
4013pmap_write_protect(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t sva, vaddr_t eva, vm_prot_t prot)
4014{
4015 pt_entry_t bit_rem, bit_put;
4016 pt_entry_t *ptes;
4017 pt_entry_t * const *pdes;
4018 struct pmap *pmap2;
4019 vaddr_t blockend, va;
4020 int lvl, i;
4021
4022 KASSERT(curlwp->l_md.md_gc_pmap != pmap);
4023
4024 if (__predict_false(pmap->pm_write_protect != NULL)) {
4025 (*pmap->pm_write_protect)(pmap, sva, eva, prot);
4026 return;
4027 }
4028
4029 bit_rem = 0;
4030 if (!(prot & VM_PROT_WRITE))
4031 bit_rem = PTE_W;
4032
4033 bit_put = 0;
4034 if (!(prot & VM_PROT_EXECUTE))
4035 bit_put = pmap_pg_nx;
4036
4037 sva &= ~PAGE_MASK;
4038 eva &= ~PAGE_MASK;
4039
4040 /* Acquire pmap. */
4041 kpreempt_disable();
4042 pmap_map_ptes(pmap, &pmap2, &ptes, &pdes);
4043
4044 for (va = sva ; va < eva; va = blockend) {
4045 pt_entry_t *spte, *epte;
4046
4047 blockend = x86_round_pdr(va + 1);
4048 if (blockend > eva)
4049 blockend = eva;
4050
4051 /* Is it a valid block? */
4052 if (!pmap_pdes_valid(va, pdes, NULL, &lvl)) {
4053 continue;
4054 }
4055 KASSERT(va < VM_MAXUSER_ADDRESS || va >= VM_MAX_ADDRESS);
4056 KASSERT(lvl == 1);
4057
4058 spte = &ptes[pl1_i(va)];
4059 epte = &ptes[pl1_i(blockend)];
4060
4061 for (i = 0; spte < epte; spte++, i++) {
4062 pt_entry_t opte, npte;
4063
4064 do {
4065 opte = *spte;
4066 if (!pmap_valid_entry(opte)) {
4067 goto next;
4068 }
4069 npte = (opte & ~bit_rem) | bit_put;
4070 } while (pmap_pte_cas(spte, opte, npte) != opte);
4071
4072 if ((opte & PTE_D) != 0) {
4073 vaddr_t tva = va + x86_ptob(i);
4074 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, tva, opte,
4075 TLBSHOOT_WRITE_PROTECT);
4076 }
4077next:;
4078 }
4079 }
4080
4081 /* Release pmap. */
4082 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2);
4083 kpreempt_enable();
4084}
4085
4086/*
4087 * pmap_unwire: clear the wired bit in the PTE.
4088 *
4089 * => Mapping should already be present.
4090 */
4091void
4092pmap_unwire(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va)
4093{
4094 pt_entry_t *ptes, *ptep, opte;
4095 pd_entry_t * const *pdes;
4096 struct pmap *pmap2;
4097 int lvl;
4098
4099 if (__predict_false(pmap->pm_unwire != NULL)) {
4100 (*pmap->pm_unwire)(pmap, va);
4101 return;
4102 }
4103
4104 /* Acquire pmap. */
4105 kpreempt_disable();
4106 pmap_map_ptes(pmap, &pmap2, &ptes, &pdes);
4107
4108 if (!pmap_pdes_valid(va, pdes, NULL, &lvl)) {
4109 panic("%s: invalid PDE va=%#" PRIxVADDR, __func__, va);
4110 }
4111 KASSERT(lvl == 1);
4112
4113 ptep = &ptes[pl1_i(va)];
4114 opte = *ptep;
4115 KASSERT(pmap_valid_entry(opte));
4116
4117 if (opte & PG_W) {
4118 pt_entry_t npte = opte & ~PG_W;
4119
4120 opte = pmap_pte_testset(ptep, npte);
4121 pmap_stats_update_bypte(pmap, npte, opte);
4122 } else {
4123 printf("%s: wiring for pmap %p va %#" PRIxVADDR
4124 " did not change!\n", __func__, pmap, va);
4125 }
4126
4127 /* Release pmap. */
4128 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2);
4129 kpreempt_enable();
4130}
4131
4132/*
4133 * pmap_copy: copy mappings from one pmap to another
4134 *
4135 * => optional function
4136 * void pmap_copy(dst_pmap, src_pmap, dst_addr, len, src_addr)
4137 */
4138
4139/*
4140 * defined as macro in pmap.h
4141 */
4142
4143__strict_weak_alias(pmap_enter, pmap_enter_default);
4144
4145int
4146pmap_enter_default(pmap_t pmap, vaddr_t va, paddr_t pa, vm_prot_t prot,
4147 u_int flags)
4148{
4149 if (__predict_false(pmap->pm_enter != NULL)) {
4150 return (*pmap->pm_enter)(pmap, va, pa, prot, flags);
4151 }
4152
4153 return pmap_enter_ma(pmap, va, pa, pa, prot, flags, 0);
4154}
4155
4156/*
4157 * pmap_enter: enter a mapping into a pmap
4158 *
4159 * => must be done "now" ... no lazy-evaluation
4160 * => we set pmap => pv_head locking
4161 */
4162int
4163pmap_enter_ma(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va, paddr_t ma, paddr_t pa,
4164 vm_prot_t prot, u_int flags, int domid)
4165{
4166 pt_entry_t *ptes, opte, npte;
4167 pt_entry_t *ptep;
4168 pd_entry_t * const *pdes;
4169 struct vm_page *ptp;
4170 struct vm_page *new_pg, *old_pg;
4171 struct pmap_page *new_pp, *old_pp;
4172 struct pv_entry *old_pve = NULL;
4173 struct pv_entry *new_pve;
4174 struct pv_entry *new_sparepve;
4175 int error;
4176 bool wired = (flags & PMAP_WIRED) != 0;
4177 struct pmap *pmap2;
4178
4179 KASSERT(pmap_initialized);
4180 KASSERT(curlwp->l_md.md_gc_pmap != pmap);
4181 KASSERT(va < VM_MAX_KERNEL_ADDRESS);
4182 KASSERTMSG(va != (vaddr_t)PDP_BASE, "%s: trying to map va=%#"
4183 PRIxVADDR " over PDP!", __func__, va);
4184 KASSERTMSG(va < VM_MIN_KERNEL_ADDRESS ||
4185 pmap_valid_entry(pmap->pm_pdir[pl_i(va, PTP_LEVELS)]),
4186 "%s: missing kernel PTP for va=%#" PRIxVADDR, __func__, va);
4187
4188#ifdef XENPV
4189 KASSERT(domid == DOMID_SELF || pa == 0);
4190#endif
4191
4192 npte = ma | protection_codes[prot] | PTE_P;
4193 npte |= pmap_pat_flags(flags);
4194 if (wired)
4195 npte |= PG_W;
4196 if (va < VM_MAXUSER_ADDRESS)
4197 npte |= PTE_U;
4198
4199 if (pmap == pmap_kernel())
4200 npte |= pmap_pg_g;
4201 if (flags & VM_PROT_ALL) {
4202 npte |= PTE_A;
4203 if (flags & VM_PROT_WRITE) {
4204 KASSERT((npte & PTE_W) != 0);
4205 npte |= PTE_D;
4206 }
4207 }
4208
4209#ifdef XENPV
4210 if (domid != DOMID_SELF)
4211 new_pg = NULL;
4212 else
4213#endif
4214 new_pg = PHYS_TO_VM_PAGE(pa);
4215 if (new_pg != NULL) {
4216 /* This is a managed page */
4217 npte |= PG_PVLIST;
4218 new_pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(new_pg);
4219 } else if ((new_pp = pmap_pv_tracked(pa)) != NULL) {
4220 /* This is an unmanaged pv-tracked page */
4221 npte |= PG_PVLIST;
4222 } else {
4223 new_pp = NULL;
4224 }
4225
4226 /*
4227 * Try to get pves now if we might need them.
4228 * Keep going even if we fail, since we will not actually need them
4229 * if we are just changing the permissions on an existing mapping,
4230 * but we won't know if that's the case until later.
4231 */
4232
4233 bool needpves = pmap_pp_needs_pve(new_pp);
4234 if (needpves) {
4235 new_pve = pool_cache_get(&pmap_pv_cache, PR_NOWAIT);
4236 new_sparepve = pool_cache_get(&pmap_pv_cache, PR_NOWAIT);
4237 } else {
4238 new_pve = NULL;
4239 new_sparepve = NULL;
4240 }
4241
4242 kpreempt_disable();
4243 pmap_map_ptes(pmap, &pmap2, &ptes, &pdes); /* locks pmap */
4244 if (pmap == pmap_kernel()) {
4245 ptp = NULL;
4246 } else {
4247 ptp = pmap_get_ptp(pmap, va, pdes, flags);
4248 if (ptp == NULL) {
4249 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2);
4250 if (flags & PMAP_CANFAIL) {
4251 error = ENOMEM;
4252 goto out;
4253 }
4254 panic("%s: get ptp failed", __func__);
4255 }
4256 }
4257
4258 /*
4259 * Check if there is an existing mapping. If we are now sure that
4260 * we need pves and we failed to allocate them earlier, handle that.
4261 * Caching the value of oldpa here is safe because only the mod/ref
4262 * bits can change while the pmap is locked.
4263 */
4264 ptep = &ptes[pl1_i(va)];
4265 opte = *ptep;
4266 bool have_oldpa = pmap_valid_entry(opte);
4267 paddr_t oldpa = pmap_pte2pa(opte);
4268
4269 if (needpves && (!have_oldpa || oldpa != pa) &&
4270 (new_pve == NULL || new_sparepve == NULL)) {
4271 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2);
4272 if (flags & PMAP_CANFAIL) {
4273 error = ENOMEM;
4274 goto out;
4275 }
4276 panic("%s: pve allocation failed", __func__);
4277 }
4278
4279 /*
4280 * Update the pte.
4281 */
4282 do {
4283 opte = *ptep;
4284
4285 /*
4286 * if the same page, inherit PTE_A and PTE_D.
4287 */
4288 if (((opte ^ npte) & (PTE_FRAME | PTE_P)) == 0) {
4289 npte |= opte & (PTE_A | PTE_D);
4290 }
4291#if defined(XENPV)
4292 if (domid != DOMID_SELF) {
4293 /* pmap_pte_cas with error handling */
4294 int s = splvm();
4295 if (opte != *ptep) {
4296 splx(s);
4297 continue;
4298 }
4299 error = xpq_update_foreign(
4300 vtomach((vaddr_t)ptep), npte, domid);
4301 splx(s);
4302 if (error) {
4303 if (ptp != NULL && ptp->wire_count <= 1) {
4304 pmap_free_ptp(pmap, ptp, va, ptes, pdes);
4305 }
4306 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2);
4307 goto out;
4308 }
4309 break;
4310 }
4311#endif /* defined(XENPV) */
4312 } while (pmap_pte_cas(ptep, opte, npte) != opte);
4313
4314 /*
4315 * Update statistics and PTP's reference count.
4316 */
4317 pmap_stats_update_bypte(pmap, npte, opte);
4318 if (ptp != NULL && !have_oldpa) {
4319 ptp->wire_count++;
4320 }
4321 KASSERT(ptp == NULL || ptp->wire_count > 1);
4322
4323 /*
4324 * If the same page, we can skip pv_entry handling.
4325 */
4326 if (((opte ^ npte) & (PTE_FRAME | PTE_P)) == 0) {
4327 KASSERT(((opte ^ npte) & PG_PVLIST) == 0);
4328 goto same_pa;
4329 }
4330
4331 /*
4332 * If old page is pv-tracked, remove pv_entry from its list.
4333 */
4334 if ((~opte & (PTE_P | PG_PVLIST)) == 0) {
4335 if ((old_pg = PHYS_TO_VM_PAGE(oldpa)) != NULL) {
4336 KASSERT(uvm_page_locked_p(old_pg));
4337 old_pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(old_pg);
4338 } else if ((old_pp = pmap_pv_tracked(oldpa)) == NULL) {
4339 panic("%s: PG_PVLIST with pv-untracked page"
4340 " va = %#"PRIxVADDR
4341 " pa = %#" PRIxPADDR " (%#" PRIxPADDR ")",
4342 __func__, va, oldpa, atop(pa));
4343 }
4344
4345 old_pve = pmap_remove_pv(old_pp, ptp, va);
4346 old_pp->pp_attrs |= pmap_pte_to_pp_attrs(opte);
4347 }
4348
4349 /*
4350 * If new page is pv-tracked, insert pv_entry into its list.
4351 */
4352 if (new_pp) {
4353 new_pve = pmap_enter_pv(new_pp, new_pve, &new_sparepve, ptp, va);
4354 }
4355
4356same_pa:
4357 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2);
4358
4359 /*
4360 * shootdown tlb if necessary.
4361 */
4362
4363 if ((~opte & (PTE_P | PTE_A)) == 0 &&
4364 ((opte ^ npte) & (PTE_FRAME | PTE_W)) != 0) {
4365 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, va, opte, TLBSHOOT_ENTER);
4366 }
4367
4368 error = 0;
4369out:
4370 kpreempt_enable();
4371 if (old_pve != NULL) {
4372 pool_cache_put(&pmap_pv_cache, old_pve);
4373 }
4374 if (new_pve != NULL) {
4375 pool_cache_put(&pmap_pv_cache, new_pve);
4376 }
4377 if (new_sparepve != NULL) {
4378 pool_cache_put(&pmap_pv_cache, new_sparepve);
4379 }
4380
4381 return error;
4382}
4383
4384paddr_t
4385pmap_get_physpage(void)
4386{
4387 struct vm_page *ptp;
4388 struct pmap *kpm = pmap_kernel();
4389 paddr_t pa;
4390
4391 if (!uvm.page_init_done) {
4392 /*
4393 * We're growing the kernel pmap early (from
4394 * uvm_pageboot_alloc()). This case must be
4395 * handled a little differently.
4396 */
4397
4398 if (!uvm_page_physget(&pa))
4399 panic("%s: out of memory", __func__);
4400#if defined(__HAVE_DIRECT_MAP)
4401 pagezero(PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(pa));
4402#else
4403#if defined(XENPV)
4404 if (XEN_VERSION_SUPPORTED(3, 4)) {
4405 xen_pagezero(pa);
4406 return pa;
4407 }
4408#endif
4409 kpreempt_disable();
4410 pmap_pte_set(early_zero_pte, pmap_pa2pte(pa) | PTE_P |
4411 PTE_W | pmap_pg_nx);
4412 pmap_pte_flush();
4413 pmap_update_pg((vaddr_t)early_zerop);
4414 memset(early_zerop, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
4415#if defined(DIAGNOSTIC) || defined(XENPV)
4416 pmap_pte_set(early_zero_pte, 0);
4417 pmap_pte_flush();
4418#endif /* defined(DIAGNOSTIC) */
4419 kpreempt_enable();
4420#endif /* defined(__HAVE_DIRECT_MAP) */
4421 } else {
4422 /* XXX */
4423 ptp = uvm_pagealloc(NULL, 0, NULL,
4424 UVM_PGA_USERESERVE|UVM_PGA_ZERO);
4425 if (ptp == NULL)
4426 panic("%s: out of memory", __func__);
4427 ptp->flags &= ~PG_BUSY;
4428 ptp->wire_count = 1;
4429 pa = VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(ptp);
4430 }
4431 pmap_stats_update(kpm, 1, 0);
4432
4433 return pa;
4434}
4435
4436/*
4437 * Expand the page tree with the specified amount of PTPs, mapping virtual
4438 * addresses starting at kva. We populate all the levels but the last one
4439 * (L1). The nodes of the tree are created as RWX, but the pages covered
4440 * will be kentered in L1, with proper permissions.
4441 *
4442 * Used only by pmap_growkernel.
4443 */
4444static void
4445pmap_alloc_level(struct pmap *cpm, vaddr_t kva, long *needed_ptps)
4446{
4447 unsigned long i;
4448 paddr_t pa;
4449 unsigned long index, endindex;
4450 int level;
4451 pd_entry_t *pdep;
4452#ifdef XENPV
4453 int s = splvm(); /* protect xpq_* */
4454#endif
4455
4456 for (level = PTP_LEVELS; level > 1; level--) {
4457 if (level == PTP_LEVELS)
4458 pdep = cpm->pm_pdir;
4459 else
4460 pdep = normal_pdes[level - 2];
4461 index = pl_i_roundup(kva, level);
4462 endindex = index + needed_ptps[level - 1] - 1;
4463
4464 for (i = index; i <= endindex; i++) {
4465 pt_entry_t pte;
4466
4467 KASSERT(!pmap_valid_entry(pdep[i]));
4468 pa = pmap_get_physpage();
4469 pte = pmap_pa2pte(pa) | PTE_P | PTE_W;
4470 pmap_pte_set(&pdep[i], pte);
4471
4472#ifdef XENPV
4473 if (level == PTP_LEVELS && i >= PDIR_SLOT_KERN) {
4474 if (__predict_true(
4475 cpu_info_primary.ci_flags & CPUF_PRESENT)) {
4476 /* update per-cpu PMDs on all cpus */
4477 xen_kpm_sync(pmap_kernel(), i);
4478 } else {
4479 /*
4480 * too early; update primary CPU
4481 * PMD only (without locks)
4482 */
4483#ifdef __x86_64__
4484 pd_entry_t *cpu_pdep =
4485 &cpu_info_primary.ci_kpm_pdir[i];
4486#else
4487 pd_entry_t *cpu_pdep =
4488 &cpu_info_primary.ci_kpm_pdir[l2tol2(i)];
4489#endif
4490 pmap_pte_set(cpu_pdep, pte);
4491 }
4492 }
4493#endif
4494
4495 KASSERT(level != PTP_LEVELS || nkptp[level - 1] +
4496 pl_i(VM_MIN_KERNEL_ADDRESS, level) == i);
4497 nkptp[level - 1]++;
4498 }
4499 pmap_pte_flush();
4500 }
4501#ifdef XENPV
4502 splx(s);
4503#endif
4504}
4505
4506/*
4507 * pmap_growkernel: increase usage of KVM space.
4508 *
4509 * => we allocate new PTPs for the kernel and install them in all
4510 * the pmaps on the system.
4511 */
4512vaddr_t
4513pmap_growkernel(vaddr_t maxkvaddr)
4514{
4515 struct pmap *kpm = pmap_kernel();
4516 struct pmap *cpm;
4517#if !defined(XENPV) || !defined(__x86_64__)
4518 struct pmap *pm;
4519 long old;
4520#endif
4521 int s, i;
4522 long needed_kptp[PTP_LEVELS], target_nptp;
4523 bool invalidate = false;
4524
4525 s = splvm(); /* to be safe */
4526 mutex_enter(kpm->pm_lock);
4527
4528 if (maxkvaddr <= pmap_maxkvaddr) {
4529 mutex_exit(kpm->pm_lock);
4530 splx(s);
4531 return pmap_maxkvaddr;
4532 }
4533
4534 maxkvaddr = x86_round_pdr(maxkvaddr);
4535#if !defined(XENPV) || !defined(__x86_64__)
4536 old = nkptp[PTP_LEVELS - 1];
4537#endif
4538
4539 /* Initialize needed_kptp. */
4540 for (i = PTP_LEVELS - 1; i >= 1; i--) {
4541 target_nptp = pl_i_roundup(maxkvaddr, i + 1) -
4542 pl_i_roundup(VM_MIN_KERNEL_ADDRESS, i + 1);
4543
4544 if (target_nptp > nkptpmax[i])
4545 panic("out of KVA space");
4546 KASSERT(target_nptp >= nkptp[i]);
4547 needed_kptp[i] = target_nptp - nkptp[i];
4548 }
4549
4550#ifdef XENPV
4551 /* only pmap_kernel(), or the per-cpu map, has kernel entries */
4552 cpm = kpm;
4553#else
4554 /* Get the current pmap */
4555 if (__predict_true(cpu_info_primary.ci_flags & CPUF_PRESENT)) {
4556 cpm = curcpu()->ci_pmap;
4557 } else {
4558 cpm = kpm;
4559 }
4560#endif
4561
4562#ifdef KASAN
4563 kasan_shadow_map((void *)pmap_maxkvaddr,
4564 (size_t)(maxkvaddr - pmap_maxkvaddr));
4565#endif
4566
4567 pmap_alloc_level(cpm, pmap_maxkvaddr, needed_kptp);
4568
4569 /*
4570 * If the number of top level entries changed, update all pmaps.
4571 */
4572 if (needed_kptp[PTP_LEVELS - 1] != 0) {
4573#ifdef XENPV
4574#ifdef __x86_64__
4575 /* nothing, kernel entries are never entered in user pmap */
4576#else
4577 int pdkidx;
4578
4579 mutex_enter(&pmaps_lock);
4580 LIST_FOREACH(pm, &pmaps, pm_list) {
4581 for (pdkidx = PDIR_SLOT_KERN + old;
4582 pdkidx < PDIR_SLOT_KERN + nkptp[PTP_LEVELS - 1];
4583 pdkidx++) {
4584 pmap_pte_set(&pm->pm_pdir[pdkidx],
4585 kpm->pm_pdir[pdkidx]);
4586 }
4587 pmap_pte_flush();
4588 }
4589 mutex_exit(&pmaps_lock);
4590#endif /* __x86_64__ */
4591#else /* XENPV */
4592 size_t newpdes;
4593 newpdes = nkptp[PTP_LEVELS - 1] - old;
4594 if (cpm != kpm) {
4595 memcpy(&kpm->pm_pdir[PDIR_SLOT_KERN + old],
4596 &cpm->pm_pdir[PDIR_SLOT_KERN + old],
4597 newpdes * sizeof(pd_entry_t));
4598 }
4599
4600 mutex_enter(&pmaps_lock);
4601 LIST_FOREACH(pm, &pmaps, pm_list) {
4602 if (__predict_false(pm->pm_enter != NULL)) {
4603 /*
4604 * Not a native pmap, the kernel is not mapped,
4605 * so nothing to synchronize.
4606 */
4607 continue;
4608 }
4609 memcpy(&pm->pm_pdir[PDIR_SLOT_KERN + old],
4610 &kpm->pm_pdir[PDIR_SLOT_KERN + old],
4611 newpdes * sizeof(pd_entry_t));
4612 }
4613 mutex_exit(&pmaps_lock);
4614#endif
4615 invalidate = true;
4616 }
4617 pmap_maxkvaddr = maxkvaddr;
4618 mutex_exit(kpm->pm_lock);
4619 splx(s);
4620
4621 if (invalidate && pmap_initialized) {
4622 /* Invalidate the PDP cache. */
4623 pool_cache_invalidate(&pmap_pdp_cache);
4624 }
4625
4626 return maxkvaddr;
4627}
4628
4629#ifdef DEBUG
4630void pmap_dump(struct pmap *, vaddr_t, vaddr_t);
4631
4632/*
4633 * pmap_dump: dump all the mappings from a pmap
4634 *
4635 * => caller should not be holding any pmap locks
4636 */
4637void
4638pmap_dump(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t sva, vaddr_t eva)
4639{
4640 pt_entry_t *ptes, *pte;
4641 pd_entry_t * const *pdes;
4642 struct pmap *pmap2;
4643 vaddr_t blkendva;
4644 int lvl;
4645
4646 /*
4647 * if end is out of range truncate.
4648 * if (end == start) update to max.
4649 */
4650
4651 if (eva > VM_MAXUSER_ADDRESS || eva <= sva)
4652 eva = VM_MAXUSER_ADDRESS;
4653
4654 /*
4655 * we lock in the pmap => pv_head direction
4656 */
4657
4658 kpreempt_disable();
4659 pmap_map_ptes(pmap, &pmap2, &ptes, &pdes); /* locks pmap */
4660
4661 /*
4662 * dumping a range of pages: we dump in PTP sized blocks (4MB)
4663 */
4664
4665 for (/* null */ ; sva < eva ; sva = blkendva) {
4666
4667 /* determine range of block */
4668 blkendva = x86_round_pdr(sva+1);
4669 if (blkendva > eva)
4670 blkendva = eva;
4671
4672 /* valid block? */
4673 if (!pmap_pdes_valid(sva, pdes, NULL, &lvl))
4674 continue;
4675 KASSERT(lvl == 1);
4676
4677 pte = &ptes[pl1_i(sva)];
4678 for (/* null */; sva < blkendva ; sva += PAGE_SIZE, pte++) {
4679 if (!pmap_valid_entry(*pte))
4680 continue;
4681 printf("va %#" PRIxVADDR " -> pa %#" PRIxPADDR
4682 " (pte=%#" PRIxPADDR ")\n",
4683 sva, (paddr_t)pmap_pte2pa(*pte), (paddr_t)*pte);
4684 }
4685 }
4686 pmap_unmap_ptes(pmap, pmap2);
4687 kpreempt_enable();
4688}
4689#endif
4690
4691/*
4692 * pmap_update: process deferred invalidations and frees.
4693 */
4694void
4695pmap_update(struct pmap *pmap)
4696{
4697 struct vm_page *empty_ptps;
4698 lwp_t *l = curlwp;
4699
4700 /*
4701 * If we have torn down this pmap, invalidate non-global TLB
4702 * entries on any processors using it.
4703 */
4704 kpreempt_disable();
4705 if (__predict_false(l->l_md.md_gc_pmap == pmap)) {
4706 l->l_md.md_gc_pmap = NULL;
4707 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, (vaddr_t)-1LL, 0, TLBSHOOT_UPDATE);
4708 }
4709
4710 /*
4711 * Initiate any pending TLB shootdowns. Wait for them to
4712 * complete before returning control to the caller.
4713 */
4714 pmap_tlb_shootnow();
4715 kpreempt_enable();
4716
4717 /*
4718 * Now that shootdowns are complete, process deferred frees,
4719 * but not from interrupt context.
4720 */
4721 if (l->l_md.md_gc_ptp != NULL) {
4722 KASSERT((l->l_pflag & LP_INTR) == 0);
4723 if (cpu_intr_p()) {
4724 return;
4725 }
4726 empty_ptps = l->l_md.md_gc_ptp;
4727 l->l_md.md_gc_ptp = NULL;
4728 pmap_free_ptps(empty_ptps);
4729 }
4730}
4731
4732#if PTP_LEVELS > 4
4733#error "Unsupported number of page table mappings"
4734#endif
4735
4736paddr_t
4737pmap_init_tmp_pgtbl(paddr_t pg)
4738{
4739 static bool maps_loaded;
4740 static const paddr_t x86_tmp_pml_paddr[] = {
4741 4 * PAGE_SIZE, /* L1 */
4742 5 * PAGE_SIZE, /* L2 */
4743 6 * PAGE_SIZE, /* L3 */
4744 7 * PAGE_SIZE /* L4 */
4745 };
4746 static vaddr_t x86_tmp_pml_vaddr[] = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
4747
4748 pd_entry_t *tmp_pml, *kernel_pml;
4749
4750 int level;
4751
4752 if (!maps_loaded) {
4753 for (level = 0; level < PTP_LEVELS; ++level) {
4754 x86_tmp_pml_vaddr[level] =
4755 uvm_km_alloc(kernel_map, PAGE_SIZE, 0,
4756 UVM_KMF_VAONLY);
4757
4758 if (x86_tmp_pml_vaddr[level] == 0)
4759 panic("mapping of real mode PML failed\n");
4760 pmap_kenter_pa(x86_tmp_pml_vaddr[level],
4761 x86_tmp_pml_paddr[level],
4762 VM_PROT_READ | VM_PROT_WRITE, 0);
4763 }
4764 pmap_update(pmap_kernel());
4765 maps_loaded = true;
4766 }
4767
4768 /* Zero levels 1-3 */
4769 for (level = 0; level < PTP_LEVELS - 1; ++level) {
4770 tmp_pml = (void *)x86_tmp_pml_vaddr[level];
4771 memset(tmp_pml, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
4772 }
4773
4774 /* Copy PML4 */
4775 kernel_pml = pmap_kernel()->pm_pdir;
4776 tmp_pml = (void *)x86_tmp_pml_vaddr[PTP_LEVELS - 1];
4777 memcpy(tmp_pml, kernel_pml, PAGE_SIZE);
4778
4779#ifdef PAE
4780 /*
4781 * Use the last 4 entries of the L2 page as L3 PD entries. These
4782 * last entries are unlikely to be used for temporary mappings.
4783 * 508: maps 0->1GB (userland)
4784 * 509: unused
4785 * 510: unused
4786 * 511: maps 3->4GB (kernel)
4787 */
4788 tmp_pml[508] = x86_tmp_pml_paddr[PTP_LEVELS - 1] | PTE_P;
4789 tmp_pml[509] = 0;
4790 tmp_pml[510] = 0;
4791 tmp_pml[511] = pmap_pdirpa(pmap_kernel(), PDIR_SLOT_KERN) | PTE_P;
4792#endif
4793
4794 for (level = PTP_LEVELS - 1; level > 0; --level) {
4795 tmp_pml = (void *)x86_tmp_pml_vaddr[level];
4796
4797 tmp_pml[pl_i(pg, level + 1)] =
4798 (x86_tmp_pml_paddr[level - 1] & PTE_FRAME) | PTE_W | PTE_P;
4799 }
4800
4801 tmp_pml = (void *)x86_tmp_pml_vaddr[0];
4802 tmp_pml[pl_i(pg, 1)] = (pg & PTE_FRAME) | PTE_W | PTE_P;
4803
4804#ifdef PAE
4805 /* Return the PA of the L3 page (entry 508 of the L2 page) */
4806 return x86_tmp_pml_paddr[PTP_LEVELS - 1] + 508 * sizeof(pd_entry_t);
4807#endif
4808
4809 return x86_tmp_pml_paddr[PTP_LEVELS - 1];
4810}
4811
4812u_int
4813x86_mmap_flags(paddr_t mdpgno)
4814{
4815 u_int nflag = (mdpgno >> X86_MMAP_FLAG_SHIFT) & X86_MMAP_FLAG_MASK;
4816 u_int pflag = 0;
4817
4818 if (nflag & X86_MMAP_FLAG_PREFETCH)
4819 pflag |= PMAP_WRITE_COMBINE;
4820
4821 return pflag;
4822}
4823
4824#if defined(__HAVE_DIRECT_MAP) && defined(__x86_64__) && !defined(XEN)
4825
4826/*
4827 * -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4828 * *****************************************************************************
4829 * *****************************************************************************
4830 * *****************************************************************************
4831 * *****************************************************************************
4832 * **************** HERE BEGINS THE EPT CODE, USED BY INTEL-VMX ****************
4833 * *****************************************************************************
4834 * *****************************************************************************
4835 * *****************************************************************************
4836 * *****************************************************************************
4837 * -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4838 *
4839 * These functions are invoked as callbacks from the code above. Contrary to
4840 * native, EPT does not have a recursive slot; therefore, it is not possible
4841 * to call pmap_map_ptes(). Instead, we use the direct map and walk down the
4842 * tree manually.
4843 *
4844 * Apart from that, the logic is mostly the same as native. Once a pmap has
4845 * been created, NVMM calls pmap_ept_transform() to make it an EPT pmap.
4846 * After that we're good, and the callbacks will handle the translations
4847 * for us.
4848 *
4849 * -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4850 */
4851
4852/* Hardware bits. */
4853#define EPT_R __BIT(0) /* read */
4854#define EPT_W __BIT(1) /* write */
4855#define EPT_X __BIT(2) /* execute */
4856#define EPT_T __BITS(5,3) /* type */
4857#define TYPE_UC 0
4858#define TYPE_WC 1
4859#define TYPE_WT 4
4860#define TYPE_WP 5
4861#define TYPE_WB 6
4862#define EPT_NOPAT __BIT(6)
4863#define EPT_L __BIT(7) /* large */
4864#define EPT_A __BIT(8) /* accessed */
4865#define EPT_D __BIT(9) /* dirty */
4866/* Software bits. */
4867#define EPT_PVLIST __BIT(60)
4868#define EPT_WIRED __BIT(61)
4869
4870#define pmap_ept_valid_entry(pte) (pte & EPT_R)
4871
4872bool pmap_ept_has_ad __read_mostly;
4873
4874static inline void
4875pmap_ept_stats_update_bypte(struct pmap *pmap, pt_entry_t npte, pt_entry_t opte)
4876{
4877 int resid_diff = ((npte & EPT_R) ? 1 : 0) - ((opte & EPT_R) ? 1 : 0);
4878 int wired_diff = ((npte & EPT_WIRED) ? 1 : 0) - ((opte & EPT_WIRED) ? 1 : 0);
4879
4880 KASSERT((npte & (EPT_R | EPT_WIRED)) != EPT_WIRED);
4881 KASSERT((opte & (EPT_R | EPT_WIRED)) != EPT_WIRED);
4882
4883 pmap_stats_update(pmap, resid_diff, wired_diff);
4884}
4885
4886static pt_entry_t
4887pmap_ept_type(u_int flags)
4888{
4889 u_int cacheflags = (flags & PMAP_CACHE_MASK);
4890 pt_entry_t ret;
4891
4892 switch (cacheflags) {
4893 case PMAP_NOCACHE:
4894 case PMAP_NOCACHE_OVR:
4895 ret = __SHIFTIN(TYPE_UC, EPT_T);
4896 break;
4897 case PMAP_WRITE_COMBINE:
4898 ret = __SHIFTIN(TYPE_WC, EPT_T);
4899 break;
4900 case PMAP_WRITE_BACK:
4901 default:
4902 ret = __SHIFTIN(TYPE_WB, EPT_T);
4903 break;
4904 }
4905
4906 ret |= EPT_NOPAT;
4907 return ret;
4908}
4909
4910static inline pt_entry_t
4911pmap_ept_prot(vm_prot_t prot)
4912{
4913 pt_entry_t res = 0;
4914
4915 if (prot & VM_PROT_READ)
4916 res |= EPT_R;
4917 if (prot & VM_PROT_WRITE)
4918 res |= EPT_W;
4919 if (prot & VM_PROT_EXECUTE)
4920 res |= EPT_X;
4921
4922 return res;
4923}
4924
4925static inline uint8_t
4926pmap_ept_to_pp_attrs(pt_entry_t ept)
4927{
4928 uint8_t ret = 0;
4929 if (pmap_ept_has_ad) {
4930 if (ept & EPT_D)
4931 ret |= PP_ATTRS_M;
4932 if (ept & EPT_A)
4933 ret |= PP_ATTRS_U;
4934 } else {
4935 ret |= (PP_ATTRS_M|PP_ATTRS_U);
4936 }
4937 if (ept & EPT_W)
4938 ret |= PP_ATTRS_W;
4939 return ret;
4940}
4941
4942static inline pt_entry_t
4943pmap_pp_attrs_to_ept(uint8_t attrs)
4944{
4945 pt_entry_t ept = 0;
4946 if (attrs & PP_ATTRS_M)
4947 ept |= EPT_D;
4948 if (attrs & PP_ATTRS_U)
4949 ept |= EPT_A;
4950 if (attrs & PP_ATTRS_W)
4951 ept |= EPT_W;
4952 return ept;
4953}
4954
4955/*
4956 * Helper for pmap_ept_free_ptp.
4957 * tree[0] = &L2[L2idx]
4958 * tree[1] = &L3[L3idx]
4959 * tree[2] = &L4[L4idx]
4960 */
4961static void
4962pmap_ept_get_tree(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va, pd_entry_t **tree)
4963{
4964 pt_entry_t *pteva;
4965 paddr_t ptepa;
4966 int i, index;
4967
4968 ptepa = pmap->pm_pdirpa[0];
4969 for (i = PTP_LEVELS; i > 1; i--) {
4970 index = pl_pi(va, i);
4971 pteva = (pt_entry_t *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(ptepa);
4972 KASSERT(pmap_ept_valid_entry(pteva[index]));
4973 tree[i - 2] = &pteva[index];
4974 ptepa = pmap_pte2pa(pteva[index]);
4975 }
4976}
4977
4978static void
4979pmap_ept_free_ptp(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t va)
4980{
4981 pd_entry_t *tree[3];
4982 int level;
4983
4984 KASSERT(pmap != pmap_kernel());
4985 KASSERT(mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
4986 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
4987
4988 pmap_ept_get_tree(pmap, va, tree);
4989
4990 level = 1;
4991 do {
4992 (void)pmap_pte_testset(tree[level - 1], 0);
4993
4994 pmap_freepage(pmap, ptp, level);
4995 if (level < PTP_LEVELS - 1) {
4996 ptp = pmap_find_ptp(pmap, va, (paddr_t)-1, level + 1);
4997 ptp->wire_count--;
4998 if (ptp->wire_count > 1)
4999 break;
5000 }
5001 } while (++level < PTP_LEVELS);
5002 pmap_pte_flush();
5003}
5004
5005/* Allocate L4->L3->L2. Return L2. */
5006static struct vm_page *
5007pmap_ept_get_ptp(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va, int flags)
5008{
5009 struct vm_page *ptp;
5010 struct {
5011 struct vm_page *pg;
5012 bool new;
5013 } pt[PTP_LEVELS + 1];
5014 int i, aflags;
5015 unsigned long index;
5016 pd_entry_t *pteva;
5017 paddr_t ptepa;
5018 struct uvm_object *obj;
5019 voff_t off;
5020
5021 KASSERT(pmap != pmap_kernel());
5022 KASSERT(mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
5023 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
5024
5025 memset(pt, 0, sizeof(pt));
5026 aflags = ((flags & PMAP_CANFAIL) ? 0 : UVM_PGA_USERESERVE) |
5027 UVM_PGA_ZERO;
5028
5029 /*
5030 * Loop through all page table levels allocating a page
5031 * for any level where we don't already have one.
5032 */
5033 for (i = PTP_LEVELS; i > 1; i--) {
5034 obj = &pmap->pm_obj[i - 2];
5035 off = ptp_va2o(va, i - 1);
5036
5037 PMAP_SUBOBJ_LOCK(pmap, i - 2);
5038 pt[i].pg = uvm_pagelookup(obj, off);
5039 if (pt[i].pg == NULL) {
5040 pt[i].pg = uvm_pagealloc(obj, off, NULL, aflags);
5041 pt[i].new = true;
5042 }
5043 PMAP_SUBOBJ_UNLOCK(pmap, i - 2);
5044
5045 if (pt[i].pg == NULL)
5046 goto fail;
5047 }
5048
5049 /*
5050 * Now that we have all the pages looked up or allocated,
5051 * loop through again installing any new ones into the tree.
5052 */
5053 ptepa = pmap->pm_pdirpa[0];
5054 for (i = PTP_LEVELS; i > 1; i--) {
5055 index = pl_pi(va, i);
5056 pteva = (pt_entry_t *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(ptepa);
5057
5058 if (pmap_ept_valid_entry(pteva[index])) {
5059 KASSERT(!pt[i].new);
5060 ptepa = pmap_pte2pa(pteva[index]);
5061 continue;
5062 }
5063
5064 ptp = pt[i].pg;
5065 ptp->flags &= ~PG_BUSY; /* never busy */
5066 ptp->wire_count = 1;
5067 pmap->pm_ptphint[i - 2] = ptp;
5068 ptepa = VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(ptp);
5069 pmap_pte_set(&pteva[index], ptepa | EPT_R | EPT_W | EPT_X);
5070
5071 pmap_pte_flush();
5072 pmap_stats_update(pmap, 1, 0);
5073
5074 /*
5075 * If we're not in the top level, increase the
5076 * wire count of the parent page.
5077 */
5078 if (i < PTP_LEVELS) {
5079 pt[i + 1].pg->wire_count++;
5080 }
5081 }
5082 ptp = pt[2].pg;
5083 KASSERT(ptp != NULL);
5084 pmap->pm_ptphint[0] = ptp;
5085 return ptp;
5086
5087 /*
5088 * Allocation of a PTP failed, free any others that we just allocated.
5089 */
5090fail:
5091 for (i = PTP_LEVELS; i > 1; i--) {
5092 if (pt[i].pg == NULL) {
5093 break;
5094 }
5095 if (!pt[i].new) {
5096 continue;
5097 }
5098 obj = &pmap->pm_obj[i - 2];
5099 PMAP_SUBOBJ_LOCK(pmap, i - 2);
5100 uvm_pagefree(pt[i].pg);
5101 PMAP_SUBOBJ_UNLOCK(pmap, i - 2);
5102 }
5103 return NULL;
5104}
5105
5106static int
5107pmap_ept_enter(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va, paddr_t pa, vm_prot_t prot,
5108 u_int flags)
5109{
5110 pt_entry_t *ptes, opte, npte;
5111 pt_entry_t *ptep;
5112 struct vm_page *ptp;
5113 struct vm_page *new_pg, *old_pg;
5114 struct pmap_page *new_pp, *old_pp;
5115 struct pv_entry *old_pve = NULL;
5116 struct pv_entry *new_pve;
5117 struct pv_entry *new_sparepve;
5118 bool wired = (flags & PMAP_WIRED) != 0;
5119 bool accessed;
5120 int error;
5121
5122 KASSERT(pmap_initialized);
5123 KASSERT(curlwp->l_md.md_gc_pmap != pmap);
5124 KASSERT(va < VM_MAXUSER_ADDRESS);
5125
5126 npte = pa | pmap_ept_prot(prot) | pmap_ept_type(flags);
5127
5128 if (wired)
5129 npte |= EPT_WIRED;
5130 if (flags & VM_PROT_ALL) {
5131 npte |= EPT_A;
5132 if (flags & VM_PROT_WRITE) {
5133 KASSERT((npte & EPT_W) != 0);
5134 npte |= EPT_D;
5135 }
5136 }
5137
5138 new_pg = PHYS_TO_VM_PAGE(pa);
5139 if (new_pg != NULL) {
5140 /* This is a managed page */
5141 npte |= EPT_PVLIST;
5142 new_pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(new_pg);
5143 } else if ((new_pp = pmap_pv_tracked(pa)) != NULL) {
5144 /* This is an unmanaged pv-tracked page */
5145 npte |= EPT_PVLIST;
5146 } else {
5147 new_pp = NULL;
5148 }
5149
5150 /*
5151 * Try to get pves now if we might need them.
5152 * Keep going even if we fail, since we will not actually need them
5153 * if we are just changing the permissions on an existing mapping,
5154 * but we won't know if that's the case until later.
5155 */
5156
5157 bool needpves = pmap_pp_needs_pve(new_pp);
5158 if (needpves) {
5159 new_pve = pool_cache_get(&pmap_pv_cache, PR_NOWAIT);
5160 new_sparepve = pool_cache_get(&pmap_pv_cache, PR_NOWAIT);
5161 } else {
5162 new_pve = NULL;
5163 new_sparepve = NULL;
5164 }
5165
5166 kpreempt_disable();
5167 mutex_enter(pmap->pm_lock);
5168
5169 ptp = pmap_ept_get_ptp(pmap, va, flags);
5170 if (ptp == NULL) {
5171 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
5172 if (flags & PMAP_CANFAIL) {
5173 error = ENOMEM;
5174 goto out;
5175 }
5176 panic("%s: get ptp failed", __func__);
5177 }
5178
5179 /*
5180 * Check if there is an existing mapping. If we are now sure that
5181 * we need pves and we failed to allocate them earlier, handle that.
5182 * Caching the value of oldpa here is safe because only the mod/ref
5183 * bits can change while the pmap is locked.
5184 */
5185 ptes = (pt_entry_t *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(VM_PAGE_TO_PHYS(ptp));
5186 ptep = &ptes[pl1_pi(va)];
5187 opte = *ptep;
5188 bool have_oldpa = pmap_ept_valid_entry(opte);
5189 paddr_t oldpa = pmap_pte2pa(opte);
5190
5191 if (needpves && (!have_oldpa || oldpa != pa) &&
5192 (new_pve == NULL || new_sparepve == NULL)) {
5193 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
5194 if (flags & PMAP_CANFAIL) {
5195 error = ENOMEM;
5196 goto out;
5197 }
5198 panic("%s: pve allocation failed", __func__);
5199 }
5200
5201 /*
5202 * Update the pte.
5203 */
5204 do {
5205 opte = *ptep;
5206
5207 /*
5208 * if the same page, inherit PTE_A and PTE_D.
5209 */
5210 if (((opte ^ npte) & (PG_FRAME | EPT_R)) == 0) {
5211 npte |= opte & (EPT_A | EPT_D);
5212 }
5213 } while (pmap_pte_cas(ptep, opte, npte) != opte);
5214
5215 /*
5216 * Update statistics and PTP's reference count.
5217 */
5218 pmap_ept_stats_update_bypte(pmap, npte, opte);
5219 if (ptp != NULL && !have_oldpa) {
5220 ptp->wire_count++;
5221 }
5222 KASSERT(ptp == NULL || ptp->wire_count > 1);
5223
5224 /*
5225 * If the same page, we can skip pv_entry handling.
5226 */
5227 if (((opte ^ npte) & (PG_FRAME | EPT_R)) == 0) {
5228 KASSERT(((opte ^ npte) & EPT_PVLIST) == 0);
5229 goto same_pa;
5230 }
5231
5232 /*
5233 * If old page is pv-tracked, remove pv_entry from its list.
5234 */
5235 if ((~opte & (EPT_R | EPT_PVLIST)) == 0) {
5236 if ((old_pg = PHYS_TO_VM_PAGE(oldpa)) != NULL) {
5237 KASSERT(uvm_page_locked_p(old_pg));
5238 old_pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(old_pg);
5239 } else if ((old_pp = pmap_pv_tracked(oldpa)) == NULL) {
5240 panic("%s: EPT_PVLIST with pv-untracked page"
5241 " va = %#"PRIxVADDR
5242 " pa = %#" PRIxPADDR " (%#" PRIxPADDR ")",
5243 __func__, va, oldpa, atop(pa));
5244 }
5245
5246 old_pve = pmap_remove_pv(old_pp, ptp, va);
5247 old_pp->pp_attrs |= pmap_ept_to_pp_attrs(opte);
5248 }
5249
5250 /*
5251 * If new page is pv-tracked, insert pv_entry into its list.
5252 */
5253 if (new_pp) {
5254 new_pve = pmap_enter_pv(new_pp, new_pve, &new_sparepve, ptp, va);
5255 }
5256
5257same_pa:
5258 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
5259
5260 if (pmap_ept_has_ad) {
5261 accessed = (~opte & (EPT_R | EPT_A)) == 0;
5262 } else {
5263 accessed = (opte & EPT_R) != 0;
5264 }
5265 if (accessed && ((opte ^ npte) & (PG_FRAME | EPT_W)) != 0) {
5266 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, va, 0, TLBSHOOT_ENTER);
5267 }
5268
5269 error = 0;
5270out:
5271 kpreempt_enable();
5272 if (old_pve != NULL) {
5273 pool_cache_put(&pmap_pv_cache, old_pve);
5274 }
5275 if (new_pve != NULL) {
5276 pool_cache_put(&pmap_pv_cache, new_pve);
5277 }
5278 if (new_sparepve != NULL) {
5279 pool_cache_put(&pmap_pv_cache, new_sparepve);
5280 }
5281
5282 return error;
5283}
5284
5285/* Pay close attention, this returns L2. */
5286static int
5287pmap_ept_pdes_invalid(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va, pd_entry_t *lastpde)
5288{
5289 pt_entry_t *pteva;
5290 paddr_t ptepa;
5291 int i, index;
5292
5293 KASSERT(mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
5294
5295 ptepa = pmap->pm_pdirpa[0];
5296 for (i = PTP_LEVELS; i > 1; i--) {
5297 pteva = (pt_entry_t *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(ptepa);
5298 index = pl_pi(va, i);
5299 if (!pmap_ept_valid_entry(pteva[index]))
5300 return i;
5301 ptepa = pmap_pte2pa(pteva[index]);
5302 }
5303 if (lastpde != NULL) {
5304 *lastpde = pteva[index];
5305 }
5306
5307 return 0;
5308}
5309
5310static bool
5311pmap_ept_extract(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va, paddr_t *pap)
5312{
5313 pt_entry_t *ptes, pte;
5314 pd_entry_t pde;
5315 paddr_t ptppa, pa;
5316 bool rv;
5317
5318#ifdef __HAVE_DIRECT_MAP
5319 if (va >= PMAP_DIRECT_BASE && va < PMAP_DIRECT_END) {
5320 if (pap != NULL) {
5321 *pap = PMAP_DIRECT_UNMAP(va);
5322 }
5323 return true;
5324 }
5325#endif
5326
5327 rv = false;
5328 pa = 0;
5329
5330 kpreempt_disable();
5331 mutex_enter(pmap->pm_lock);
5332
5333 if (!pmap_ept_pdes_invalid(pmap, va, &pde)) {
5334 ptppa = pmap_pte2pa(pde);
5335 ptes = (pt_entry_t *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(ptppa);
5336 pte = ptes[pl1_pi(va)];
5337 if (__predict_true((pte & EPT_R) != 0)) {
5338 pa = pmap_pte2pa(pte) | (va & (NBPD_L1 - 1));
5339 rv = true;
5340 }
5341 }
5342
5343 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
5344 kpreempt_enable();
5345
5346 if (pap != NULL) {
5347 *pap = pa;
5348 }
5349 return rv;
5350}
5351
5352static bool
5353pmap_ept_remove_pte(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, pt_entry_t *pte,
5354 vaddr_t va, struct pv_entry **pv_tofree)
5355{
5356 struct pv_entry *pve;
5357 struct vm_page *pg;
5358 struct pmap_page *pp;
5359 pt_entry_t opte;
5360 bool accessed;
5361
5362 KASSERT(pmap != pmap_kernel());
5363 KASSERT(mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
5364 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
5365
5366 if (!pmap_ept_valid_entry(*pte)) {
5367 /* VA not mapped. */
5368 return false;
5369 }
5370
5371 /* Atomically save the old PTE and zap it. */
5372 opte = pmap_pte_testset(pte, 0);
5373 if (!pmap_ept_valid_entry(opte)) {
5374 return false;
5375 }
5376
5377 pmap_ept_stats_update_bypte(pmap, 0, opte);
5378
5379 if (ptp) {
5380 /*
5381 * Dropping a PTE. Make sure that the PDE is flushed.
5382 */
5383 ptp->wire_count--;
5384 if (ptp->wire_count <= 1) {
5385 opte |= EPT_A;
5386 }
5387 }
5388
5389 if (pmap_ept_has_ad) {
5390 accessed = (opte & EPT_A) != 0;
5391 } else {
5392 accessed = true;
5393 }
5394 if (accessed) {
5395 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, va, 0, TLBSHOOT_REMOVE_PTE);
5396 }
5397
5398 /*
5399 * If we are not on a pv_head list - we are done.
5400 */
5401 if ((opte & EPT_PVLIST) == 0) {
5402 KASSERTMSG((PHYS_TO_VM_PAGE(pmap_pte2pa(opte)) == NULL),
5403 "managed page without EPT_PVLIST for %#"PRIxVADDR, va);
5404 KASSERTMSG((pmap_pv_tracked(pmap_pte2pa(opte)) == NULL),
5405 "pv-tracked page without EPT_PVLIST for %#"PRIxVADDR, va);
5406 return true;
5407 }
5408
5409 if ((pg = PHYS_TO_VM_PAGE(pmap_pte2pa(opte))) != NULL) {
5410 KASSERT(uvm_page_locked_p(pg));
5411 pp = VM_PAGE_TO_PP(pg);
5412 } else if ((pp = pmap_pv_tracked(pmap_pte2pa(opte))) == NULL) {
5413 paddr_t pa = pmap_pte2pa(opte);
5414 panic("%s: EPT_PVLIST with pv-untracked page"
5415 " va = %#"PRIxVADDR"pa = %#"PRIxPADDR" (%#"PRIxPADDR")",
5416 __func__, va, pa, atop(pa));
5417 }
5418
5419 /* Sync R/M bits. */
5420 pp->pp_attrs |= pmap_ept_to_pp_attrs(opte);
5421 pve = pmap_remove_pv(pp, ptp, va);
5422
5423 if (pve) {
5424 pve->pve_next = *pv_tofree;
5425 *pv_tofree = pve;
5426 }
5427 return true;
5428}
5429
5430static void
5431pmap_ept_remove_ptes(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t ptpva,
5432 vaddr_t startva, vaddr_t endva, struct pv_entry **pv_tofree)
5433{
5434 pt_entry_t *pte = (pt_entry_t *)ptpva;
5435
5436 KASSERT(pmap != pmap_kernel());
5437 KASSERT(mutex_owned(pmap->pm_lock));
5438 KASSERT(kpreempt_disabled());
5439
5440 /*
5441 * note that ptpva points to the PTE that maps startva. this may
5442 * or may not be the first PTE in the PTP.
5443 *
5444 * we loop through the PTP while there are still PTEs to look at
5445 * and the wire_count is greater than 1 (because we use the wire_count
5446 * to keep track of the number of real PTEs in the PTP).
5447 */
5448 while (startva < endva && (ptp == NULL || ptp->wire_count > 1)) {
5449 (void)pmap_ept_remove_pte(pmap, ptp, pte, startva, pv_tofree);
5450 startva += PAGE_SIZE;
5451 pte++;
5452 }
5453}
5454
5455static void
5456pmap_ept_remove(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t sva, vaddr_t eva)
5457{
5458 struct pv_entry *pv_tofree = NULL;
5459 pt_entry_t *ptes;
5460 pd_entry_t pde;
5461 paddr_t ptppa;
5462 vaddr_t blkendva, va = sva;
5463 struct vm_page *ptp;
5464
5465 kpreempt_disable();
5466 mutex_enter(pmap->pm_lock);
5467
5468 for (/* null */ ; va < eva ; va = blkendva) {
5469 int lvl;
5470
5471 /* determine range of block */
5472 blkendva = x86_round_pdr(va+1);
5473 if (blkendva > eva)
5474 blkendva = eva;
5475
5476 lvl = pmap_ept_pdes_invalid(pmap, va, &pde);
5477 if (lvl != 0) {
5478 /* Skip a range corresponding to an invalid pde. */
5479 blkendva = (va & ptp_frames[lvl - 1]) + nbpd[lvl - 1];
5480 continue;
5481 }
5482
5483 /* PA of the PTP */
5484 ptppa = pmap_pte2pa(pde);
5485
5486 ptp = pmap_find_ptp(pmap, va, ptppa, 1);
5487 KASSERTMSG(ptp != NULL, "%s: unmanaged PTP detected",
5488 __func__);
5489
5490 ptes = (pt_entry_t *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(ptppa);
5491
5492 pmap_ept_remove_ptes(pmap, ptp, (vaddr_t)&ptes[pl1_pi(va)], va,
5493 blkendva, &pv_tofree);
5494
5495 /* If PTP is no longer being used, free it. */
5496 if (ptp && ptp->wire_count <= 1) {
5497 pmap_ept_free_ptp(pmap, ptp, va);
5498 }
5499 }
5500
5501 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
5502 kpreempt_enable();
5503
5504 /* Now we free unused PVs */
5505 if (pv_tofree)
5506 pmap_free_pvs(pv_tofree);
5507}
5508
5509static int
5510pmap_ept_sync_pv(struct vm_page *ptp, vaddr_t va, paddr_t pa, int clearbits,
5511 uint8_t *oattrs, pt_entry_t *optep)
5512{
5513 struct pmap *pmap;
5514 pt_entry_t *ptep;
5515 pt_entry_t opte;
5516 pt_entry_t npte;
5517 pt_entry_t expect;
5518 bool need_shootdown;
5519
5520 expect = pmap_pa2pte(pa) | EPT_R;
5521 pmap = ptp_to_pmap(ptp);
5522
5523 if (clearbits != ~0) {
5524 KASSERT((clearbits & ~(PP_ATTRS_M|PP_ATTRS_U|PP_ATTRS_W)) == 0);
5525 clearbits = pmap_pp_attrs_to_ept(clearbits);
5526 }
5527
5528 ptep = pmap_map_pte(pmap, ptp, va);
5529 do {
5530 opte = *ptep;
5531 KASSERT((opte & (EPT_D | EPT_A)) != EPT_D);
5532 KASSERT((opte & (EPT_A | EPT_R)) != EPT_A);
5533 KASSERT(opte == 0 || (opte & EPT_R) != 0);
5534 if ((opte & (PG_FRAME | EPT_R)) != expect) {
5535 /*
5536 * We lost a race with a V->P operation like
5537 * pmap_remove(). Wait for the competitor
5538 * reflecting pte bits into mp_attrs.
5539 *
5540 * Issue a redundant TLB shootdown so that
5541 * we can wait for its completion.
5542 */
5543 pmap_unmap_pte();
5544 if (clearbits != 0) {
5545 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, va, 0,
5546 TLBSHOOT_SYNC_PV1);
5547 }
5548 return EAGAIN;
5549 }
5550
5551 /*
5552 * Check if there's anything to do on this PTE.
5553 */
5554 if ((opte & clearbits) == 0) {
5555 need_shootdown = false;
5556 break;
5557 }
5558
5559 /*
5560 * We need a shootdown if the PTE is cached (EPT_A) ...
5561 * ... Unless we are clearing only the EPT_W bit and
5562 * it isn't cached as RW (EPT_D).
5563 */
5564 if (pmap_ept_has_ad) {
5565 need_shootdown = (opte & EPT_A) != 0 &&
5566 !(clearbits == EPT_W && (opte & EPT_D) == 0);
5567 } else {
5568 need_shootdown = true;
5569 }
5570
5571 npte = opte & ~clearbits;
5572
5573 /*
5574 * If we need a shootdown anyway, clear EPT_A and EPT_D.
5575 */
5576 if (need_shootdown) {
5577 npte &= ~(EPT_A | EPT_D);
5578 }
5579 KASSERT((npte & (EPT_D | EPT_A)) != EPT_D);
5580 KASSERT((npte & (EPT_A | EPT_R)) != EPT_A);
5581 KASSERT(npte == 0 || (opte & EPT_R) != 0);
5582 } while (pmap_pte_cas(ptep, opte, npte) != opte);
5583
5584 if (need_shootdown) {
5585 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, va, 0, TLBSHOOT_SYNC_PV2);
5586 }
5587 pmap_unmap_pte();
5588
5589 *oattrs = pmap_ept_to_pp_attrs(opte);
5590 if (optep != NULL)
5591 *optep = opte;
5592 return 0;
5593}
5594
5595static void
5596pmap_ept_pp_remove_ent(struct pmap *pmap, struct vm_page *ptp, pt_entry_t opte,
5597 vaddr_t va)
5598{
5599 mutex_enter(pmap->pm_lock);
5600 pmap_ept_stats_update_bypte(pmap, 0, opte);
5601 ptp->wire_count--;
5602 if (ptp->wire_count <= 1) {
5603 pmap_ept_free_ptp(pmap, ptp, va);
5604 }
5605 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
5606}
5607
5608static void
5609pmap_ept_write_protect(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t sva, vaddr_t eva, vm_prot_t prot)
5610{
5611 pt_entry_t bit_rem;
5612 pt_entry_t *ptes, *spte;
5613 pt_entry_t opte, npte;
5614 pd_entry_t pde;
5615 paddr_t ptppa;
5616 vaddr_t va;
5617 bool modified;
5618
5619 bit_rem = 0;
5620 if (!(prot & VM_PROT_WRITE))
5621 bit_rem = EPT_W;
5622
5623 sva &= PG_FRAME;
5624 eva &= PG_FRAME;
5625
5626 /* Acquire pmap. */
5627 kpreempt_disable();
5628
5629 mutex_enter(pmap->pm_lock);
5630
5631 for (va = sva; va < eva; va += PAGE_SIZE) {
5632 if (pmap_ept_pdes_invalid(pmap, va, &pde)) {
5633 continue;
5634 }
5635
5636 ptppa = pmap_pte2pa(pde);
5637 ptes = (pt_entry_t *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(ptppa);
5638 spte = &ptes[pl1_pi(va)];
5639
5640 do {
5641 opte = *spte;
5642 if (!pmap_ept_valid_entry(opte)) {
5643 goto next;
5644 }
5645 npte = (opte & ~bit_rem);
5646 } while (pmap_pte_cas(spte, opte, npte) != opte);
5647
5648 if (pmap_ept_has_ad) {
5649 modified = (opte & EPT_D) != 0;
5650 } else {
5651 modified = true;
5652 }
5653 if (modified) {
5654 vaddr_t tva = x86_ptob(spte - ptes);
5655 pmap_tlb_shootdown(pmap, tva, 0,
5656 TLBSHOOT_WRITE_PROTECT);
5657 }
5658next:;
5659 }
5660
5661 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
5662 kpreempt_enable();
5663}
5664
5665static void
5666pmap_ept_unwire(struct pmap *pmap, vaddr_t va)
5667{
5668 pt_entry_t *ptes, *ptep, opte;
5669 pd_entry_t pde;
5670 paddr_t ptppa;
5671
5672 /* Acquire pmap. */
5673 kpreempt_disable();
5674 mutex_enter(pmap->pm_lock);
5675
5676 if (pmap_ept_pdes_invalid(pmap, va, &pde)) {
5677 panic("%s: invalid PDE va=%#" PRIxVADDR, __func__, va);
5678 }
5679
5680 ptppa = pmap_pte2pa(pde);
5681 ptes = (pt_entry_t *)PMAP_DIRECT_MAP(ptppa);
5682 ptep = &ptes[pl1_pi(va)];
5683 opte = *ptep;
5684 KASSERT(pmap_ept_valid_entry(opte));
5685
5686 if (opte & EPT_WIRED) {
5687 pt_entry_t npte = opte & ~EPT_WIRED;
5688
5689 opte = pmap_pte_testset(ptep, npte);
5690 pmap_ept_stats_update_bypte(pmap, npte, opte);
5691 } else {
5692 printf("%s: wiring for pmap %p va %#" PRIxVADDR
5693 "did not change!\n", __func__, pmap, va);
5694 }
5695
5696 /* Release pmap. */
5697 mutex_exit(pmap->pm_lock);
5698 kpreempt_enable();
5699}

5701/* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5702
5703void
5704pmap_ept_transform(struct pmap *pmap)
5705{
5706 pmap->pm_enter = pmap_ept_enter;
5707 pmap->pm_extract = pmap_ept_extract;
5708 pmap->pm_remove = pmap_ept_remove;
5709 pmap->pm_sync_pv = pmap_ept_sync_pv;
5710 pmap->pm_pp_remove_ent = pmap_ept_pp_remove_ent;
5711 pmap->pm_write_protect = pmap_ept_write_protect;
5712 pmap->pm_unwire = pmap_ept_unwire;
5713
5714 memset(pmap->pm_pdir, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
5715}
